Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: hanne n
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at Best Point Hotel and it made our stay in Istanbul superb. We have never met such hospitality and helpfulness. The whole staff was on their toes all the time. Its situation in Istanbul makes it easy to walk to most major sights and the tramway is within walking reach also. We cannot recommend the hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “A truly delightfull hotel in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Rita Pineda W
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was not part of our tour in Turkey, so I did a thorough research of the hotels located in the Sultanahmet area. My decision was based on the many good reviews, and found them to be true. We had an ensuite room, that was nicely decorated, clean, and with a turkist bath. The breakfast was sumptuous and delicious. Amazing location ( walking distance, 5 mins to the most important sights) To top this is the very gracious and helpful staff. We are very please and highly recommend Best Point to anybody thinking of an Istanbul visit. .

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: Our family of four plus Grandparents arrived very late after a delayed flight. We were picked up by a very friendly driver, taken to the hotel where, at 3 am, we were very warmly welcomed. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. All the staff were very helpful and friendly, the rooms were good, the breakfast wonderful and the location amazing! We would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Istanbul! Thank you Fatih - you and your team made us feel very very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point, best choice.”
Reviews.Author: SilviaCatana
Reviews.Content: The location was the first thing that led us to choose the hotel Best Point. If you want to visit beautiful Istanbul, this hotel has great location, very near to some important tourist attractions. The pleasant surprise was to discover that this hotel is very cozy and pleasant. Accommodation is very good and staff is very helpful. I have nothing but praise and heartily recommend this hotel. I hope we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Hotel in the historic heart of old Istanbul is really the Best Point to hang out.”
Reviews.Author: Mario S
Reviews.Content: This was original my Christmas present, a long weekend in Istanbul. And to be honest, the best one. Not just because the city and the people are amazing, but also because the really nice experience in the Best Point Hotel during our stay. Alone the owner of the hotel Mr. Fatih, take care of each coming guest personally, helping immediately to advice you with all information what you have to see during your stay in perfect englisch. Use all the recommendation from the stuff, they really care and know. Also use the transportation option from and to the airport offered by hotel Best Point, the service is professional for less money than regular taxi. Free offered drinks and refreshments during you stay, make the trip even much more beautifull. Nice breakfirst and dayly cleaned and romantic rooms make it happened. Fully Recommended. Just a 3 minutes walk from the old city center. Mario

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended - Very Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: tradition1
Reviews.Content: Are there negative stars? We bad experience with this hotel from the start. Regarding the other good reviews, don't believe all. I saw the staff on their laptop there writing reviews for the hotel in their free time. Our own experience, there is NO HEAT in the bathroom. We stayed in February. It was very cold use the toilet or shower! The breakfast is terrible. Most foods are sweet like cakes that have been there for days. If im going to pay high price, please give me some real hot food. Orange juice is charged separately (they dont tell you it's extra when they ask u if u want OJ, they just hand u the bill to sign with the oj. This is not fair.) The staff were very annoying when we ate breakfast because they all just stood there looking at what foods you pick, how much food u take and how you eat. Very annoying. We took a deluxe room and there is no frig or coffee maker in room. if u dont have kitchen, then at least they should have a small coffee maker. The cleaning staff dont know english, turkish or how to read basic signs. We put a Privacy sign on door and the cleaning lady just walked in on us! The local people that live across the street from hotel are nosy and intrusive to ur privacy. we had our curtains open and they kept peeking thru their windows seeing what we do. I'm never, never, never going to stay in this hotel! i wanted to leave early but we already paid for the rooms. They call this Best Point Hotel. It should rather be called Worst Point Hotel to better describe their crummy joint. There are other nicer hotels in this old historic area that are better and cost less. After this bad experience, we went to stay at nearby Erboy a bit north and had a nice stay there to make up for this bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Hotel is like staying with family”
Reviews.Author: Thair D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with about 10 of my family and friends for 6 nights, what a great place and staff. Ride was arranged for us from the airport to hotel, staff greeted us every time we walked in or out and offered us complimentary Chai, coffee or apple tea (definitely try the apple tea) every time. By far the best hotel I have ever stayed at in any country. On top of that its a great location, my room had a balcony with a direct sight line to the historic Blue Mosque. Best point is within walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and cheap and easy to use train system. Best hotel staff I've ever encountered... If you're going to Istanbul and want a great location with great service and people its the only choice. Thank you my new friend and owner Fatih. Thank you my new friends and helpful staff Gokhan, Artun, Mustafa and Tugrul. I fell in love with Istanbul, Turkey, the Turkish people and the best point hotel. I will see all you guys again in the near future on my next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point is the Best of the Best in all of Turkey!”
Reviews.Author: Riz-n-Saf
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about Fatih and his wonderful staff at Best Point in Sultanahment. From the moment we arrived, the staff treated us with the utmost care and ensured that we had no issues checking in and getting settled. The apple tea and various drinks they provided anytime we passed through the lobby was great and made us feel at home. Not only were the services great, Fatih and every member of his staff, including Yorkan, Mustafa and Ertan are very kind and friendly people that are great to talk to and get information from as they are all very knowledgeable about everything and anything in Istanbul. Our room was very clean and very comfortable and had all the amenities you would ever expect. Any requests we had were completed immediately. The mattress was excellent and we got a good night`s sleep after spending hours on our feet in Istanbul every day. The breakfast at Best Point was incredible and had an excellent variety of breakfast foods and drinks, better than the large North American hotel chains. The location of Best Point is incredible. It`s only a few steps away from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace so it is a great starting point for all the sightseeing in Sultanahmet. It is also very close to the tram station if you want to visit the Asian side of Istanbul such as the Galata Tower and Taksim Square. As frequent travelers, I have to say that Best Point is the best hotel we have stayed at and the experience my wife and I had there really makes us want to visit Istanbul again very soon. While in Turkey, we also visited Pamukkale, Ephesus and Antalya and I realised no other hotel compared to Best Point. It is truly the best. Thank you Fatih, Yorkan, Mustafa, Erkan and everyone else at Best Point for the excellent experience and world-class service and we are sure that on our next visit to Istanbul, we will definitely stay at Best Point and see you very soon again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point...Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iman A
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Best Point Hotel for 5 nights. What an excellent service and ideal location! The manager, Fatih and his staff were very friendly and helpful, they all make you feel at home. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there on my next trip to Istanbul. Iman, Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luis V
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband went to Istanbul last week 23/03 2012. We had a very friendly welcome from the staff at the Best Point Hotel after a long tiring trip. The entire time we were in Istanbul the staff at the hotel were very helpful and could'nt do enough for us. Our room was clean and comfortable and the cleaning service was very good every day. We had clean towels and clean bed sheets. The mini bar was well stocked and we can recommened the wine which was not a bad price either. The breakfast was delicious with a variety of foods and drinks daily. Again very helpful staff when you wanted something specific, for example english breakfast tea or lighting the roof top terrace when it was closed for winter so we could sit there and enjoy the wine and views. We would recommend the restaurant Amedros in Sultanhamet delicious food especially the sultans dish prepared in a clay pot with lamb. Had a fab time and would go back to this cosy home from home hotel. The only two things my husband would like me to comment on is the fact that our room was a little small but fine for a couple and other guests could be noisy at night going in and out of there rooms. The hotel could do with having better, more substantial doors. xxx

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Hotel is the correct name of this pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nina S
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel in the middle of the night and was very well received by a service-minded staff. The rooms were clean and delicate. The bathroom contained the amenities you want. Breakfast is tasty and the staff accommodating and service minded. The location is right in the center of old town. No noise at night. What more could you want? Recommend it to those who think a trip to Istanbul! Nina from Norway

Reviews.Title: “Best Point was Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: Graham H
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful and friendly from the start and made us really welcome. Nothing was ever too much trouble. The owner was keen and a fund of local knowledge. He wanted to make sure we had everything we needed. We thought that we were in a 'one-off' hotel that had its own personality. The room was excellent with comfortable large bed for the tall, excellent bathroom (light could have been brighter) and there was plenty of storage space. Breakfast was buffet style with a very good choice and eggs to order. The hotel location was quiet but only a 10 minute stroll to the main tourist attractions and plenty of local restaurants. After a hard day's sightseeing back to the hotel for a cup of apple tea or coffee with cake. If it wasn't there you just had to ask. Would definitely recommend the hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “we love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alberto B
Reviews.Content: what to say about Best Point hotel? that is simply perfect:The location is 5 minuts to the blue mosque, the staff is very friendly and helpfull, the room is nice and clean and the owner Mr. Fatih is great. We were very lucky !

Reviews.Title: “Best Point is the best place”
Reviews.Author: Felicity B
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - close to the major attractions. All t he staff were very friendly and helpful in every way. Our room was pleasantly furnished and very large as we were three people - myself, my cousin and my grandson (15 yrs.). I will certainly recommend it to anyone I hear is visiting Istanbul - we had a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Somaia
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations. Very clean and charmingly decorated. It is very conveniently located to many of the attractions and surrounded by great restaurants. Staff are very friendly and hospitable. They greet guests with a warm drink and Turkish sweet every time we walk in . The owner Fatih is extremely knowledgeable and speaks perfect English. He was like a personal tour guide. He suggested and/or planed most of the day trips, evening entertainments, and even transportation for sightseeing and to and from the airport. Breakfast was a fabulous feast of Turkish food. The cook even took special orders and staff were always there with a smile catering to guests every need. Afternoon tea was a nice treat. Overall A+ and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, great location”
Reviews.Author: MBM1005
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for visiting all the major attractions. The room was very clean with everything needed provided, WiFi reception was great. The breakfast was incredible and the staff - especially Kizmet and Turkan were only too pleased to help and encourage sampling all the great Turkish cuisine! We stayed when the weather was very cold and so were not able to take advantage of the rooftop facilities. Thanks to everyone for a fantastic, fascinating trip.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights of perfect hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah N
Reviews.Content: Visited Istanbul in the coldest weather. Fateh and his team of dedicated staff made a priority of my every comfort. My accommodation was clean as a whistle, Everything was of very high taste and people friendly. Location was perfect, very close to all the attractions in Sultanahmet and also very close to the trams. Hotel staff were extremely helpful regarding directions and also made any reservations that were needed. The thing that will take me back to this hotel is the personal service and sincerity of all the staff. Lots of restaurants nearby and a beautiful walk in any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: Viaggiatrice S
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay at your hotel very much !!! The staff is great, very friendly and kind. The hotel is situated in an excellent position, just few steps from the major attractions and there are many restaurants nearby. Our room was very clean and comfortable, and although it was an economy room it disposed of a balcony, great !! I would reccomend Best Point Hotel to everyone and we will for sure choose this hotel again for our next stay in Istanbul !!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely clean place to stay :D”
Reviews.Author: 1lpage
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time in istanbul, from the min we got there they was so welcoming and helpful. Everyday they asked was everything ok and if they could do anything else for us.. I would say to anyone stay there :) Will defo go back when we stay in istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right behind the Blue Mosque in the Sultanahmet area. You can walk to the major sites (Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, etc.). Highly recommend it. Breakfast on the roof is quite a walk up 5 floors, so if you have a problem with that, you probably shouldn't get a room here. Once up there, though, there are great views of the Sea of Marmara and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere and central position”
Reviews.Author: SasiRoma
Reviews.Content: These are the 2 main characteristics of Best Point Hotel: all the personnel, starting from the young owner Fatih, are very kind, nice and let you really feel at home; we did appreciate the friendly atmosphere and the support and suggestions they gave us on everything. The position is really strategic, very close to Sulthanamet Square; you can go and visit some of the most popular places in 5 minutes walking. The Hotel is really nice and romantic with small but clean and comfortable rooms. We were 2 couples coming from Rome and we've been there from 3rd to 7th of January 2012; we had a very pleasant stay in this hotel that we do suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a holiday in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Swisstourists
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel a great place to stay: top location, quiet and so close to the best attractions of the city, the Deluxe room was spacious and clean. The pick up service from the airport was included in the package and simplified all the issues regarding the transfer. The Hotel Manager and his Team are very professional, kind and helpful. And the breakfast buffet, with plently of local home-made specialties, is a great way of starting the day. Definetely to recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your hard earnt money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Razwan
Reviews.Content: The stay in this hotel was an amazing experience. I honestly can say from the many hotels i have stayed in this is got to the best. The staff are absolutely brilliant, they are so very helpfu. The rooms are very good and to a good standard and overall cleansiness is brilliant. The location is 1min from the blue mosque, you cant get no closer!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet with good vibes”
Reviews.Author: pernette008
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate booking at this very nice little hotel. The staff is friendly, the rooms are good quality with personalised decoration, there is a relaxed family atmosphere, it feels like home, much nicer than a big unpersonal 5 star hotel as far as I am concerned. Besides, it is just perfectly located. Children are obviously very welcome too.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zsolt N
Reviews.Content: It has been our third visit to Istanbul, stayed at various hotels, sometimes difficult to choose with the high number of places and websites, and I think we have found the best place for a short stay. I can highly recommend Best Point Hotel to everyone in search of great location, hospitality, comfortable beds, plentiful breakfast, internet access, wifi, etc. There is attention to detail on many levels, Fatih goes out of his way to meet your travel needs, welcomes each guest, organises day tours if you need. Again: you can not go wrong choosing this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff”
Reviews.Author: frambich
Reviews.Content: Fatih made our trip worthwile. We arrived from Egypt when the revolution happened and booked Best point thank to Trip advisor and we don 't regret our choice. Great location, friendly staff. Large breakfast, not fine food but well for this price it's already a lot. Always good advices from Fatih and his team with someone at the reception 24/7 and always helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious enough for our big luggages as they have spacious wardrobes. Would definitly recommend all my friends to go to Best point to discover old Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Istanbul Experience”
Reviews.Author: Omer T
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect experience at the Best Point Hotel. Our room was beautifully furnished and meticulously clean, breakfast was high quality and diverse, and the hotel's central location made our excursions to the city easy and fun. Most importantly, the staff's uninhibited and genuine friendly attitude and willingness to help made our stay really wonderful. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: SantoriniDreaming426
Reviews.Content: Best Point was a great surprise and unexpected treat. We were upgraded to a Deluxe Room due to a slight misunderstanding about our reservation that was excellent, highly recommended and much larger than the standard room. The location of the hotel is perfect - close to restaurants and all of the Sultanahamet sites we wanted to visit. We enjoyed the restaurants that were recommended by the staff and would definitely stay here again. Fatih helped us out at the end of our trip when we accidently left a camera in the taxi he had arranged. The taxi returned our camera to the cruise terminal which was service above and beyond all expectations. The airport transfer arranged by the hotel was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Dyh104
Reviews.Content: I decided to book this hotel after reading all the great reviews on trip advisor. I was not disappointed: great location, good service, lovely rooms if a little on the small side. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Denise M
Reviews.Content: Best Point surpassed our expectations! We loved everything-from the minute you walk in they know your name, offer you a drink and get you aquanted with the Istanbul and what you plan to do by showing the hotel location and the sites on a map! WiiFii is on every floor and is super fast! The room and hotel are exceptional-clean in every way, modern facilities and beautiful! Location is perfect for all the sites! Staff is amazing-so helpful and polite-it's wonderful! The breakfast is the best we have had in Istanbul-so many choices, omletes if you want, many baked goods that are delicious, fresh fruits, many choices of meats and cheeses. They accomadated our late checkout, I saw them make travel arrangments for others, they make dinner reservations or hammam reservations if you want. I would go back to Best Point!!! The owner is wonderful-very polite and helpful! So is his entire staff-very nice!! Loved Best Point Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdnanC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights. It was absolutely amazing and is right next to all the tourist spots and restaurants. We stayed in four different hotels during away stay in Istanbul and this was by far the best out of them all. We were in the deluxe room. The bed was very comfortable, room size was good and restroom was big as well. Everything was nice and clean. Staff was really really friendly. Both mornings we had early appointment and even though they serve breakfast from 8-10am we were able to have breakfast even at 7:30am. we will definitely stay here again and recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Staff”
Reviews.Author: SanjayRunwal
Reviews.Content: The Standard Rooms are too small and so are the toilets. The Deluxe Room is wonderful. Breakfast is wholesome. Vegetarians have less choice. The lady handling the kitchen is rigid and not prepared to give Vegetarian adaptations of some 'with egg dishes' to be prepared without eggs. Generally the spread is good. Staff is cooperative. The owner or so is what I presume him to be is a young guy but a little loud and boisterous. I doubt that he over charges for the day trips which he organizes through SHE tours. Other hotels charge much less. I recommend that one check thoroughly before booking any tours with this Hotel. Otherwise I found the Hotel to be very conveniently located. Good service. The staff is very helpful and speak good English. The Sulthanhamet tram station is walking distance and so are the Blue Mosque the Sophia Hagia and the Tapkopi Palace. The Grand Bazaar and the Spice Bazaar are very close by. I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: kmina
Reviews.Content: Hotel Best Point is literally just that - the best possible point of location in Istanbul. If this is your first time, you will not be disappointed. As other reviews stated, this hotel is located within walking distance of all the must-see locations in the Old Town of Istanbul and incredibly close to the tram for quick access to the farther flung sites. We particularly enjoyed the staff and were truly impressed with their kindness, service and willingness to make us feel at home. Upon arrival, we were greeted by the owner. He talked us through each day of our stay, making wonderful recommendations. Our room was incredibly comfortable, the linens so cozy, and the space used as efficiently as possible. We loved Hotel Best Point and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “first visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bsetterfield
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Best Point hotel in Istanbul and it was excellent , the staff very helpful and friendly.we were their in march and it was very cold but rhe hotel was very warm, the room was very comfort able and clean .The location of the hotel the blue mosque , mosaic museum .Hagia Sofia, Topkapi palace and grand Bazaar are all in walking distance. The spice bazaar a short trip on the metro.Some of the best restaurants are within 250 metresthis hotel was a great find and would recomend it yo anyone

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: bushbaby61
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Best Point in July - our first visit to Istanbul - and feel we couldn't have chosen a better spot, ideal for all the main historic sites. From the moment the driver met us at the airport to the moment we were dropped off we were made to feel like honoured guests. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff who were unfailingly smiling, helpful and considerate and would put many a glamorous 5 star hotel to shame. The room was small but well furnished, clean and comfortable with a fabulous shower which was very welcome after the dribbly greek island efforts we had experienced. Breakfast was a veritable feast - so much choice and so many delicious flavours! As previous reviewers have mentioned we got the "orientation" from Fatih and ended up purchasing tours - but his information was very helpful and we were definitely not pressured into buying. His recommendations were sound and we were glad we took them - it helped us make the most of our all too brief stay. I can't wait to return to Istanbul and when I do I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia J
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this place! Beautiful roof top, great location, friendly and helpful staff, great clean rooms and AMAZING breakfast! My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights on our trip to Turkey and everything was top notch for a very reasonable price. The staff was very helpful on sight seeing in Istanbul and things to do. I am not a person who writes reviews very often but I had to for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Can't say enough good things”
Reviews.Author: bearman69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at this hotel So happy we chose the Best Point . Great location 5 minutes walk to Hagia Sophia , Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern . Wonderful breakfast on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus great way to start our day. Front desk could not do enough to assist, Room was spotless, bed comfy, bathroom all marble with a glass shower, On departure our shuttle picked us up at 4 AM . Duty manager had a small breakfast and coffee waiting for us at 345. As we left he and his assistant stood on the steps and waved goodbye, Each day we came back to the hotel we sat at the table out front and the front desk sent out apple tea as they knew we enjoyed it . Used the shuttle service from the hotel , Our flight was delayed 1 3/4 hrs and it was nice to see our driver at arrivals with our name in big letters , they had monitored our flight arrival time as promised . One thing to note the hotel does not have an elevator, so be prepared as the roof top terrace is a roof top terrace .We never touched our luggage from arrival till departure . Also with our room facing the Blue Mosque the morning call to prayer the first time caught us unaware, but the 2nd and 3rd were incredible to hear and provided some great video and story for our friends and family to share . Great staff, great location, great price, can,t go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Syaff extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: Edmond C
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very helpful and courteous. Nothing seemed too much trouble. Because of my wifeâ€™s walking difficulty due to recent surgery our booked standard room was changed to a ground floor luxury room at the duty managerâ€™s suggestion, no hesitation , no problem. We couldnâ€™t have wished for a better room. It was clean comfortable, just what we needed. Whatever we needed for breakfast was bought to us in the ground floor garden area. All of the staff from the owner to the room maid made us feel very special. Good advice and recommendations for resuarants and places to visit was given and readily arranged if needed. The whole experience was excellent. The Best Point Hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed at you get 5* personal treatment. We have stayed at some very expensive big hotels but Best Point puts them in the shade because youâ€™re made to feel important.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neve48
Reviews.Content: Great location about 5 mins away from the Blue Mosque etc but in a surprisingly quiet street. Room was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. Staff are extremely friendly and helpful - could not ask for more. And as for the breakfast - its a sight to behold - half a room full of food - amazing! We really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - staff is very service minded!”
Reviews.Author: BjornLongva
Reviews.Content: We had not planned to stay in this hotel, but we had some trouble with the hotel booking we did from Norway - so we ended up in Best Point. And we were not sorry for that. The rooms were just excellent, and the staff very helpful. Besides that, the location of the hotel is just perfect, just 5 minutes away from 'everything' .. So if we go back to Istanbul, Best Point Hotel will definately be our choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Service, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: smithdxx
Reviews.Content: Something about me: When I travel, I prefer a basic hotel with friendly, caring service that has clean, remodeled or newer interiors, nice bathrooms, Free wi-fi, and breakfast that has variety and is included with my stay. Best Point met all of these requirements and more. The Rooms: Our group consisted of 2 adults and 2 kids (3,5yrs). We stayed in both the Triple Deluxe and the Triple Standard at different times during our stay. The rooms were beautifully arranged and suited us nicely. Some reviewers previously complained about the size of the rooms, but with 4 people in the Standard Triple, we felt we had plenty of room. We were out all day long, so we only came here to sleep. Bed wasn't the most plush thing in the world, but I didn't care. The wi-fi was awesome! Every floor has it's own router, even the rooftop, so you always have a wonderful connection to stay in touch. Location: I feel like this hotel is a hidden gem. With all of the choices you have in Istanbul, this hotel looks brand new, is down the street from the Blue Mosque and Arasta Bazaar. Some of the most highest rated restaurants listed on Trip Advisor are within a block or so of Best Point Hotel- we ate at Metropolis and Albura Kathisma. The metro stop is only about a 5-10 minute walk in front of the Pudding Shop area (for goodness sake don't eat at the Pudding Shop, though- it's awful) Ratings: We scoured Trip Advisor and all of the "other" travel websites looking for the perfect place and Best Point rates very well. Service: One thing that really stands out is that they actually have the staff's pictures on the website. Almost every review gets a response from the Manager, Fatih. This tells me that they are really taking your stay seriously. They are concerned about your happiness and they are taking accountability for it. Breakfast: I love to eat and another thing that makes me happy is variety in my food choices. I loved the breakfast here. So much variety. If you get there mid way through breakfast, there will be traditionally cooked dishes waiting for you at the buffet. They offer an omelette bar! You can have your eggs cooked to order, not just an omelette. I finally figured out that and started ordering my eggs sunnyside up- yum. So many cheeses, mezes, oatmeal toppings and pastries. Staff: The staff was amazing. They were welcoming, friendly and helpful. We fell in love with almost all of them. Gokhan, Fatih (even better looking in person- so handsome), Fatih #2, Kismet (breakfast service), Hussein (our driver), I apologize for not remembering everyone's names- they were all charming and helpful. They loved our kids and were so nice to them at all times! Highly recommended on many levels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position in the faboulous Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Giovanni_Benassi
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, with comfortable and charming rooms. The staff was gentle and helpful, the breakfast was rich and tasty. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet, only 3 minutes far from Bue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and all the beauties of Istanbul. Unfortunately also the Muezzin calling to prayer can be heard very well!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but they put us in a hotel down the street our first night”
Reviews.Author: sleeder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I reserved a room in the Best Point for 4 nights through hotels.com, but upon arrival, the host claimed that they were doing work on our room so they had to put us in a hotel down the street for the first night. He apologized and upgraded our room for our second night, but we were not impressed. It just felt like a scam. That being said, they did put us in a decent hotel for that first night, but it wasn't nearly as nice as the Best Point. The Best Point itself is a really nice place to stay at a great price. If we actually stayed in their hotel for the length of our stay, I would have given 5 stars in a heartbeat...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: seegull
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Best Point. The staff were friendly and very helpful, taking our breakfast up to the terrace every morning. The location is fantastic, a two minute walk from the Blue Mosque and lots of restaurants nearby. Beds are comfortable and the showers are great.

Reviews.Title: “Best and friendliest place”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWells31
Reviews.Content: Best point is brilliant. I have never been so impressed with the helpfulness and friendliness of all of the staff. Trips were suggested and arranged which were excellent e.g. you must go the the kalamar restaurant. The owner will arrange it all for you including free pick up at hotel. Beat that! Drinks can be brought to the roof top where the view of the Blue Mosque is fantastic. The hotel is situated in a lovely street full of friendly and interesting retaaurants in the Old Quarter. The Blue Mosque is less than 5 minutes walk and this makes navigation to the hotel so simple. Quite simply..go there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: rami75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Point Hotel in the beginning of April, 2011. The staff at this hotel really make an effort to make their guets feel very welcome and loved. This hotel is a quaint hotel filled with turkish hospitality and charm. I stayed their with my husband and dauther (age 6). The location of this hotel to many attractions and restaurants is excellent and could not be better. The hotel is very clean and spacious. The owner of the hotel really understands what service is all about from toursim needs of his clients to the basics of a comforting cup of tea. Thank you from us for making our experience such a memorable and enjoyable one. We hope to return one day. Rami and family.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, wonderful staff, comfortable clean bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: P0lly123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, staff very friendly and will go to great lengths to ensure your stay with them is comfortable and enjoyable. The hotel is located very close to the Blue Mosque, Ayasofya and Topkapi place all these places are reached within a short walk. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Istanbul either as a couple or a family. I stayed here with my two children. The breakfasts are super plenty of choice with fresh fruit and bread every day. The rooms are cleaned everyday and the beds are very comfy. A super place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best family run hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SandJLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We are in the middle of our 5 night stay here at the Best Point with friend. The location is outstanding with all of the major sites within walking distance. There is no shortage of good quality restaurants and cafes, all with the great atmosphere you would expect in Istanbul. The hotel itself is very pleasant with nice rooms and a brilliant roof top terrace providing great views of the Blue Mosque. The owner is extremely pleasant and helpful. Nothing seems to be too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “clean, quiet, good service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jojo1234_11
Reviews.Content: This place has a fantastic location just a couple of blocks from the Blue Mosque. The staff are super, just very accomodating and not pushy. Rooms are a very good size for Istanbul, and a re very clean, good maid service and extras. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AhmadFakih
Reviews.Content: We stay 4 days at Best Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel speaks of its name. It is one of the best. Great location, clost to all the attraction sites, tram. The hotel is clean and in a great quiet location on the street and surrounded with great restaurants and pubs. Nice view from the hotel roof to the blue mosque and the Phosphorus. The staff and their manager (Fatih) were very professional,and helpful. They do everything to ensure your stay is very comfortable. Loved Istanbul and I would go back there and choose the same hotel. Ahmad Fakih

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location..!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tomo123MidlandsUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Best Point Hotel, location is great - only couple of hundered metres from Blue Mosque and similar distance to Hagia Sofia & Topkapi palace along quiet cobbled streets. Plenty of decent bars and restaurants just along the same street, but still quiet enough for peaceful nights sleep. The owner of the hotel Fatih is very helpful and efficient organising tours, transfers, taxis etc. He helped us plan the best itinerary to get the most from our trip by working around the days that some of the main attractions are closed. The hotel itself is a small 'boutique' style hotel, we had 'Deluxe'room and it was well appointed and clean & quiet. If you plan to visit the Dolmabache Palace then I recommend an early start to get there whens it opens at 9am, as the queues for tickets later in the day are huge. The tramway is a cheap, easy and convenient way to reach Dolmabache Palace and other sights. In summary great trip made all the better by a good hotel and attentive owner...even the weather (Some rain and cold) could not detract from the overall memories of our trip to the wonderfully busy city that is Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: DafniV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at best point for 4 days. The personnel was very friendly, helpful and discreet. It's a cozy hotel, well maintained. The deluxe room was quite big and nicely furnished. The location is very convenient. Everything worked out pretty smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean. Reasonable choice for Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: NZFamilyTravellers5
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean. Reasonable sized bathrooom. Small rooms, enough to fit 1 big bed and 1 single bed for my children but little room to walk or place luggage. Quiet (we were on 3rd floor). Great balcony overlooking Blue Mosque. Very good location - 3 mins walk to Blue Mosque and Ayasophia museum and lots of restaurants (try Sofa Cafe just up the rd). Good service, staff were friendly/. Agree about breakfast as previous reviewer. Lots of stuff but did not seem particularly good quality and poor choice of fresh breads (why? given the great choice and cheapness of breads in Turkey). It was OK but compared to other hotels the worst breakfast we had in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: elenikok
Reviews.Content: the hotel is new and beautiful ,really close to all attractions!! Absolutly impressed!!A Special thank you to the staff ! From the time we arrived until the time we check out we were treated like their friends! Really not much more to say!Everything was perfect!!! helpful and friendly staff and owner! Thank you for making our vacations peacefull and funny! We will keep in touch and hopefully we will be back soon! Best staff! and absolutely Best Point to stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind stink of cigarettes in non-smoking room, this place is OK”
Reviews.Author: RonaColorado
Reviews.Content: Complaints: The biggest complaint about this hotel is that for four days our room constantly reeked of cigarette smoke. There are NO SMOKING signs all over the hotel ... it must have been due to the ventilation system of the building, even during most of the night it was almost as if somebody was in our room smoking. The breakfast has a lot of variety, but they put things out day after day to the point that there were always some stale items. And when we got down to the breakfast room a bit after 10, although the food was all still laid out, we were told quite rudely that we could not have any. The staff need to be trained not to stare and glower at guests. On the third and fourth floors, on the street side you get a view of the Blue Mosque, but also street noise and the loud call to prayer. As mentioned by other reviewers, the rooms and bathroom are small, but not tiny. There is no place but the floor to put down a suitcase -- the safe takes up room in the wardrobe to prevent being able to set down a suitcase in there. As mentioned they only changed towels and linens every other day. If our room hadn't stank of tobacco and the breakfast had been fresher, we'd have been satisfied for our $120 a night. Best Point seemed perhaps overpriced, but to be fair, we did not look at the other hotels in the area to get a fair comparison. The good things: Excellent location for the big tourist sights - a very short walk to Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Hagia Sophia, several museums, and plenty of shopping and restaurants. This is a mixed blessing, however. We felt like we were living in a tourist trap. In this part of Istanbul, f you acknowledge in any way people's greetings, they don't let up. It's annoying to have to be rude and ignore everyone, but EVERYBODY in this neighborhood is touting their shop, or guide service, or something and it really gets old fast. It's not like that in the rest of the city, so the location is great for a very quick sightseeing visit, but definitely wrong for a longer stay. Umit at the front desk staff was nice, no pressure, and very helpful when a taxi driver was ripping us off -- I asked what the fare should have been, and he helped me pay only that and get the driver to go away without any troubles. (Beware - the meter was on, but the driver somehow pulled a fast one) Free wifi was reliable with my own laptop. Free CPU terminal in lobby looked like it was busy most of the time, but still a nice thing that they offer it. There is a roof top terrace we discovered by mistake when we overshot our room going up stairs, where you can sit and enjoy views of the Blue Mosque to one side and the Bosporus to the other side. Speaking of stairs, there is no elevator. The staff are eager to help with luggage, but if stairs are a problem for you, a room on the 3rd or 4th floor would a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Exploresummore
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the middle of the evening and caught a shuttle to the Best Point Hotel. Right as we walked in the door, we were very warmly welcomed. We were offered a place to sit in the lobby while they checked us in and offered us beverages. In asking what they offered to drink, the attendant smiled and said, "Everything." The rooms were very clean, proper, and comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and offered a wide array of Turkish staples...one of the best breakfasts I ate in all of Turkey. The staff, as mentioned above, were very helpful and kind as we set off the next day, helping with directions and recommendations. Above all else, it was very conveniently located and secure. The name says it all, and surely when I return to Istanbul, I know where I'll be staying again...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: Seem27
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family and this hotel had everything that we were looking for. On our arrival we were greeted at the hotel by the owner Fatih Yildrim and his wonderful staff. The owner chartered out an excellent plan of all that we wanted to see in the city and around. Since we were travelling on our own we stuck to the schedule and covered everthing that there was to see during our stay.Fatih's excellent staff specially Jack was quite popular with our kids. Excellent room service, breakfast and very well kept and tidy rooms added flavor to our wonderful stay in Istanbul. We are already planning our next visit to Turkey with Best Point/Fatih to tour the Greco-Roman Asian part of Turkey before fall this year. Would recommend this place to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Aura020
Reviews.Content: I really like to stay in Best Point Hotel. When we came, we are given 4th floor room which is challenging for my mom. Directly the owner acknowledge our problem and gave the solution without extra cost. The room is very clean as well. The staffs are very polite and knowledgeable about Istanbul. Since we are traveling on our own, they also provide the tips how to use our time efficiently yet cover the important spots in Istanbul. The owner also arranged our trip to Ephesus. Overall I am very happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The Name of the Hotel Says it ALL-BEST POINT to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: FruitBat2011
Reviews.Content: Arranging our trip within only a couple days of arriving at the hotel, we received the best possible value for a reasonable price at Best Point. This charming little place has the nicest of staff and extremely clean accommodations. Because of our comfy quarters, we felt like we had a second home in Istanbul, which is reassuring to know in this big and often confusing city. Though we didn't need much help getting around, the people at Best Point offered good advice to the other guests who asked for assistance. We were always treated with respect and greeted with smiling faces and pleasant conversation. The included breakfast was also fresh and delicious, though the fresh juices were a little pricey at an extra 2 Euros for a small glass. They even accommodated our request for a sucuk and egg plate one morning for a small fee. We couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is Magical, Hotel Best Point is highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: casablanca05
Reviews.Content: Hotel BP is 5-15minutes walk to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar (shopping), Marmara Sea; just 15-20minutes walk to historical Galata Bridge, the Spice Market, Boat Tours along Bosphorous Strait, Sirkesi Train Station, and trams that would take travellers to these marvellous places. Although many hotels are close to these sights, Hotel BestPoint stands-out for friendly personalized services by its staffs, helpful&knowledable frontdesk, and a manager/owner (Fatih) available 24/7, someone you can talk to anytime. Int'l airport Ataturk 20-25minutes by taxi, BP pick-up service is available & reliable.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Marty1987767
Reviews.Content: Best point Hotel is perfect for its location: 3 minutes on food and you're arrive to Aghia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The view is very beautiful at night and the place is a very quiet. The hotel's staff is very friendly!I recomended this hotel to spend a nice peaceful holidays in Istanbul. The rooms are very large and well appointed. Breakfast is very rich and internationally. You can find everything from sweet to savory!!!!!! Return to the airport was very efficient and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!!”
Reviews.Author: IORFA
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying the The Best Point in MAR 2011 with 3 friends. We had a great time in Istanbul which did not surprise any of us. We were greatly surprised by the level of personal service we received at the lovely Best Point hotel. They arranged a wonderful tour to Cappadocia for us and everything went off without a hitch. We were met back at the airport and our friendly driver returned us to our lovely home away from home. The entire staff was attentive, friendly and willing to help whether in booking tours, recommending cafes or directions to all the amazing sights that were a short walk away from the front door of this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: seascape100
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe I picked out the Best Point Hotel off of Trip Advisor and really did very little research on the place other than just read the reviews. What a gem. The owner is as personable as you will find anywhere in the world. The service is spectacular. I truly for the first time in all my travels felt at home in this hotel. I will look no further for a hotel choice in Istanbul than the Best Point. We are already planning on coming back in the fall and part of that is to stay here again. Also, the location cannot be beat. Great restaurants everywhere. Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace all within blocks. Shopping around the corner. Istanbul is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - Great price and location”
Reviews.Author: bp487
Reviews.Content: Reception upon arrival is excellent as tea is offered while you relax and the front desk takes care of your paperwork. We booked an economy room but were offered a free upgrade. The room was in excellent condition and beautifully decorated. Free wireless internet service is provided and the reception is excellent with a router located on every floor. Breakfast was very good with many different Turkish cheeses, meats and pastries to sample. We really enjoyed it aside from the free juices offered, which seemed as though they were sitting out for quite some time. Fresh squeezed juice is available for a low price (2,5 TL) however. My only complaint is that the room we were offered was not very well insulated from outside noises and smells. I was woken up several times by doors closing in the middle of the night as well as people merely walking by the room. Cigarette smoke also lingered in our room when people in nearby rooms smoked. Due to the design of the hotel building it would be difficult to get a room isolated from noise, so this may be a consideration if you are a light sleeper. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel. It is an excellent value and located close to all of the sights of Istanbul; though be sure to take the tram/funicular over to Taksim square - we really enjoyed this area too!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the BEST”
Reviews.Author: izz05
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Istanbul for holiday with my family.Stayed at Best Point Hotel for the 2nd time and the hotel was at its BEST as usual.I will not mention about location,hotel rooms,value,breakfast and cleanliness because i feel basically its about the same standard for all hotel(3 stars) in Sultanahmet area.What make the difference about a hotel is its service from the hotel staff.That where owner Mr Fatih from Best Point Hotel come in.He will be in the hotel lobby every morning to greet you when you going to have breakfast.You can also ask him for any information about Istanbul and will give good advice to you.Everytime he see you he will offer turkish tea without fail(free of charge)When i was there we talked like we were old friends because i was more interested in doing things like the local do.He gave me advice where the local eat.shop and do for leisure.As i have been to Istanbul for the 5th time in 10 years i have done all the tourist things.His staff were also very friendly and always smiling when they see you.So i make a pledge to myself that if im going to Istanbul i will ONLY stay at BEST POINT HOTEL.Stay at this hotel and you will know what i mean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: schmanman
Reviews.Content: Upon my arrival I was met by the manger, Mr Fatih Yidirim with a cup of apple tea and some turkish delight, I had also arranged a tour to Cappadocia and he had my tour info and documents in hand. I found the hotel to be comfortable and clean and a GREAT staff that was always there if needed!! This type of service is rare today, and it was so much appreciated-when ever in the lobby I was always greeted by name. I highly recommend this property, you wont be disappointed! Again I offer my thanks to Mr Fatih Yildirim and his fine staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lyondragon
Reviews.Content: Very nice location in the old district of Istanbul (Constantinople if you prefer!!).Only 5 to 10 minutes to everything (SultanAhmet mosque;HagiaSophia church,Main Bazaar....),the hotel is charming:clean,very well-run, possibilities to organise any kind of tours,big buffet breakfast,pick up at the airport,free internet,good security.Most of all:great welcome with friendly and helpful staff due to a nice smilling manager always on site to solve immediatly any problems and to give you satisfaction very quickly.A highly recommended place.Good discount prices in the lower season.

Reviews.Title: “Great inviroment Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: blessedangie
Reviews.Content: Very clean, within 5 minutes all I required was met, the Owner and the stuff helped me feel home and at the same time they were discreet and respected my privecy. My stay in all the 15 days at Best Point Hotel was very plesent!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect balance between quality and affordability”
Reviews.Author: Out2SeeWorld
Reviews.Content: We are Americans who live and work in Turkey, so we have stayed at many hotels since we have been here. Affordability is often one of the most important factors for us when we are choosing our accommodations. The Best Point Hotel turned out to be a very good value compared to other hotels we have seen in Istanbul. The staff went out of their way to be both friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and modern, and the breakfast buffet was very nice. We would be happy stay here again on our future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel to stay downtown”
Reviews.Author: Tsako
Reviews.Content: Very good location, country style decoration, clean rooms, very very friendly and very very helpful staff, fantastic breakfast. Sure one of the best place to stay. I will visit it again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point is the BEST POINT to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: AnastasiaLyulka
Reviews.Content: In January of 2011 we stayed at Best Point Hotel for the second time and really enjoyed it a lot! Friendly staff, cosy rooms, positive attitude of the personnel made our stay at the hotel very nice and pleasant! The location is very nice in the historial part of Istanbul, close to famous places like Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque; the hotel is very near to the tram station, from which went to the city centre (to Galata Tower, to Dolmabakhche Palace). Plus it is very near to the sea side, very beautiful and romantic!Many cosy restaurants and cafes close to the hotel. My advise is BEST POINT if you really want to enjoy Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Yuco21
Reviews.Content: Helpful and courteous staff, who helped put together an itinerary for the 1.5 days I was there. They did try to sell a tour package, but were not too pushy about it. The breakfast is quite nice, with a good assortment of cheeses a part of the spread. However, it's definitely overpriced. I paid 49Euros a night for a room and realised that most hotels which were equally good and in the same area had rates between 25 and 35.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price and location for Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: MTulsaP
Reviews.Content: The Best Point Hotel in Istanbul was a gem of a find. It is tucked away in a corner, yet on a major restaurant street in Sultanamet. We could walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in just under 5 minutes. Jack was particularly helpful. He took care of any request we made and did his best to ensure our comfort. We did not leave until 8:30 at night, and the hotel was more than happy to keep our bags the entire day. The breakfast was excellent, the best we had in Turkey. Filtered coffee- no Nescafe!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service,value and location”
Reviews.Author: bocabella33432
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many of the best hotels around the world and the Best Point ranks among any of them for attentive and individual service. All the staff in this family run hotel go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable stay in Istanbul. They will arrange transportation toi and from the airport upon request as well as advise and book excursions for their guests. The location in Sultanahmet is perfect for walking to all the major points on interest. I chose the Blue Mosque Suite for it's terrace and view overlooking.......yes you guessed it.....the blue mosque.It was a perfect choice and a new experience to be woken up in the early morning by the call to prayer. Rooms are traditionally but modestly furnished but include a safe and a minibar. Breakfast is included in the rate and affords a wide variety of choice. There is a terrace on the top floor which affords a magnificent view of the city. I recommend this hotel for all travellers. I was travelling alone and I have never been taken care of so well in any hotel as I was at the Best Point.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and ideally situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mandean
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend break (sat-tues) and was really happy with our stay.I was a bit worried about past review concerning the pressure put on at the check in but it was nowhere near as bad as it has been portrayed,Fatih the manager/owner was pleasant enough and gave us a rundown of the services of the hotel and offered us a drink and some locum ,we were shown to our room top floor deluxe and was really impressed with the decor very classy oldy worldy type decor which we loved.The bed was two single pushed together to make up a double but it didnt bother us at all.The breakfast was typically Turkish (we travel Turkey extensively and I was aware ot the Turkish cuisine) with breads ,jams,cheeses,meats,fruits nuts and olives there was also an omelet service which were delicious I guess they would have made up some fried eggs if you wanted but we never bothered.There was a fresh fruit juice service but was chargeable 2 euros I think Orange or Pomegranite juices were the main fruits and they were excellent..The hotel is really in one of the best positioned in Istanbul for sightseeing tucked away behind the Blue Mosque amongst the back street restaurants you really cant be better placed.Free internet service in reception is a godsend and we used it to check in with our internal flights to Izmir and the hotel printed off the itinery with out any problem.There are probably cheaper hotels in the area but there are also some very expensive ones quite close by but what you see mainly on the reviews on Trip Advisor is about right for the Best Point Hotel a well positioned quality hotel with good breakfast and clean warm rooms.My only gripe if you can call it that is there wasnt a coffeemaker /kettle in the room but didnt spoil our stay.Well done Best Point we will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: best point is definitely an excellent, comfortable, and safe place to stay while in istanbul. i moved to Best Point from a different (and nightmarish) hotel, so i can say Best Point is clean, has excellent/friendly/helpful/very kind staff, and is a perfect location if you are looking to stay in the Sultanahmet area. the free internet worked great, which is important to me. the things you might want to be prepared for beforehand are that there is quite a bit of noise from both the street and the hotel interior (i dont know if this can be avoided anywhere in istanbul to be honest), and also the room is a little small (but modern & nicely decorated, also a very comfortable bed). i might have preferred if there were a little more heat as it was particularly cold weather while i was there. the electricity surged off for a few seconds once or twice each night, but...that could have been the whole block for all i know. in any case, it came back on after a few seconds, and wasn't a very big deal. personally if i returned to istanbul, i would opt to stay around Taksim instead of Sultanahmet, as Sultanahmet is just too flashy/touristy/everyone harassing you on the street to spend money, for my taste. but i was quite grateful to have a safe, clean, & comfortable room after my first experience, and Best Point is a great option for a moderately priced hotel in Sultanahmet, which is the area where many of Istanbul's historical sites are located.

Reviews.Title: “Best point Hotel- Best Hotel in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Roman_Travellers
Reviews.Content: Even if 3 monthes later, I would wish Mr Fatih who has been very helpful and friendly with me and my husband. He gave us the right tips to visit the most important place in in short time and with a terrible weather ( warm and wet), and managed a very cheap return service to Sabiha Gomchen airport. The hotel is walking distance from the most important touristic place of Istanbul and provide wireless internet service. Thnak you Fatih from Francesco and Silvia.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SUPERB IN EVERY WAY !!!!”
Reviews.Author: lgenser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this small family-run hotel for 3 days, proir to joining a tour of the country. From the moment we were picked up at the airport ( you can arrange this by emailing Fatih, the owner), and met with smiles at the hotel, we were treated like royalty. In minutes we were drinking tea and offered Lokum /Turkish Delight ( the local sweet), and had our rooms upgraded- without even asking!. When we were using the free internet in the lobby we were served freshly baked cookies- right out of the oven. We really felt like home! The staff is very well -trained , professional, warm and friendly. English is spoken, and so there is no problem with communication. The hotel opened about 2 years ago and so the rooms and bathrooms are modern. Everything was spotless and very comfortable, beds included. An excellent, large and varied buffet breakfast was included in the very reasonable room rate. The hotel is in the old town of Istanbul, the Sultanamet, and is within walking distance to all the major sites. There are many stores and restaurants right outside the door. It is a perfect location for a stay in Istanbul. We highly recommend a stay at Best Point. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay-clean, convenient, perfect location to sites.”
Reviews.Author: Centralmaine
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience while staying here this past week. I wished some previous reviews had taken some time to describe the hotel and surroundings a bit more so we could have a better sense of things and that will be my attempt here. My wife and I arrived early evening on a Friday after a red-eye flight from Washington, DC to Frankfurt and then a slightly delayed flight to Istanbul. Our driver was waiting for us outside of baggage claim with a placard containing our name, just as the hotel promised. This decreased a lot of anxiety on whether they would be there or not. It was about 20-25 minutes to the hotel with light traffic. The hotel is located on what I would describe as the backside of the hill where the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are located. All the roads in the neighborhood are cobblestoned and narrow. Check-in was great with an offer to relax in the parlor with a complimentary glass of wine. Soon we were joined by a member of the staff who highlighted some sites on a map and made some suggestions on where to go when. There was no pressure to go on tours as some others have mentioned. We were dog tired and wanted to get to our room. We were a bit disappointed as we explicitly reserved a deluxe room with a Jacuzzi, but got one with a Turkish bath instead. I was thinking it was an inferior room, but apparently they are both the same price. They moved us to one the next day, so all worked out, as my wife used the Jacuzzi a couple of times. The flat screen TV is very tiny so just be prepared. It did have nearly 400 channels, but only three are in English (1, 2, 4). The other disappointing feature, but perhaps the norm here is the lack of an alarm clock. There is no way to check the time unless you have a watch. Furthermore, it would have been great to listen to the various radio stations and Turkish music. Oh, you will find the beds VERY firm (translate: hard). Pillows are very thin and they only give you a duvet, no sheet or blanket. I think these issues may be a Euro thing. They do give you two pillows, so you can double them up slightly. Breakfast was in the basement with a big buffet. It is a great spread and too much than anybody would need. Many of the offerings are what we would have for an afternoon snack (olives, cheeses, olive spreads, meats, etc.), but it was fun. The meats looked old and were drying up, we didnâ€™t touch them. Omelets are made to order, but were a bit too greasy for me. Orange juice is extra (2 euros, I believe). But they have cookies, hazelnut spreads, dried apricots, yogurt, raisins, etc. The main building with lobby is about 4 stories with a roof-top terrace. This has a great view of the Blue Mosque with several bean bag chairs to lounge in. There are many tables, presumably used for eating in the warmer months. As you head into the back, you cross through a small parlor, out into a tiny courtyard and into another building. It looks as if this was another building located on the back street that may have purchased, torn down and built into a â€œmatchingâ€� part of the original hotelâ€™s style. This is where our room was located with a view out over a narrow street. This too, has a roof-top terrace, but a bit lower than the other one. As you exit the hotel, you will see that it is pretty trashy directly ahead. A dumpster with a lot of trash spilling around, alas, welcome to Turkey. Plus, you will see many stray cats as you will around the rest of Istanbul. If you take a right up the narrow street, you go a short distance to a main intersection. All along there are other boutique hotels, restaurants, cafes, and some shops. If you go straight 2-3 blocks, you come right to the Four Seasons. If you take a left up the hill, you start heading in the direction of the Mosque. However, if you keep heading straight off this road, you enter a courtyard with many outdoor seats and tables. You will find a very large bazaar heading left at this point with many, many shops that seem relatively quiet of tourists and no sales pressure. If you exit the hotel and take a left down the hill, it seems a bit shady, as we started to go this way at night. We discovered later that it is plenty safe. You go under the train tracks and this opens up to a street on the left with 2-3 restaurants. We ate at the first one on the left (on the corner) as somebody rated it good on a Web review. We would agree. By the way, it is important to note that two buildings down to the left of the hotel is a small convenient store. We regularly bought some bottles of beer here (Efes) and some chips to munch on. Very inexpensive alternative to sitting in a bar. By the way, heads up on walking around these local streets (and elsewhere). Sidewalks are narrow, if they exist at all, and often taken up with cafes, shop displays, etc. This forces you into the street, but drivers here are aggressive and yield little to pedestrians. You will find cars routinely going the wrong way on one-way streets and often motorcycles and scooters driving on the sidewalks. We also found the prayer calls at 6:30 am (heard at any hotel anywhere) very mystical and alluring. We actually looked forward to hearing them before going back to sleep. Everywhere around the hotel I would consider very safe. Just start walking around and donâ€™t be afraid if it doesnâ€™t look like much, there is always a gem around the bend. We were gone literally all day, leaving at 9 am and returning at 5 pm most every day so we spent little time here. I hope this helps more with the physical description of the place and neighborhood. We would easily return to the Best Point.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: mytimeoff
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel by reading reviews and picked this to be the best for us. The reviews were right. We stayed one week and received a free upgrade to a nicer room for 4 nights. The location was perfect for walking to the amazing nearby sites. For a wonderful view of the area be sure to go up to the rooftop terrace. The beds were very nice and provided a restful night of sleep. We had also used the internet to find prices for a tour to Cappadocia and Ephesus. I sent this to Best Point Hotel owner Fatih. He arranged a better tour at a cheaper price and it added a balloon flight in Cappadocia ! He did this thru Yume Tour Agency owner Remzi. The hotel offers many local excursions but we took only one since they were rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Istanbul, staff really care about you.”
Reviews.Author: Geoffnhils
Reviews.Content: Fatih and his staff are wonderfully helpful in all possible ways. There's a good travel agent next door, and a really good, cheap restaurant on the corner nearby with a set menu at the best price we saw anywhere in town. Literally a stone's throw from the Blue Mosque and not far from the other major tourist sites. Being in the Sultanahmet area it could be a problem to find parking - we were not driving!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, friendly staff, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: itouzin
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited Istanbul together and stayed in a deluxe twin room at the Best Point Hotel. The room was elegantly decorated, very clean, and good size, especially by European standards. Fatih and all the other staff were super helpful and nice to us. The hotel is located literally 5-10 minutes leisurly walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and the Topkapi palace, and about 10-15 min. walk to the incredible Grand Bazzar. There are dozens of very good restaurants and shisha bars all around the hotel. We mostly explored on our own, but also took an all day tour Fatih recommended, which we liked a lot. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city, tiny but pretty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Smita025
Reviews.Content: Rooms are really tiny but beautifully decorated The receptionist is loud and will force/try to sell tickets to concerts and turkish dance. The hotel is centrally located and a lot of attractions are at walkable distance. No amenities other than the coffee maker. The staff need to be softspoken and sophesticated. They are a bunch of immature youngsters who keep playing loud music in the reception lounge. Food was avearge. They dont have a seperate restaurant. But the breakfast will be served in the basement which really tiny and congested again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly but breakfast breads were stale”
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Best Point hotel and found the staff friendly and helpful. Crisp linens on the bed and a nice room. It's not as close to the Blue Mosque and Haga Sophia as some but only a couple blocks down. The mattress was very firm (too firm for me) and the continental breakfast featured a plethora of beautiful baked goods but all of them were stale.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell42
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Turkish Grandprix and can't fault the hotel. Perfect location, quiet but about 2 minutes walk to all the main sights plus on a fantastic street of restuarants. Staff in the hotel were absolutely amazing, welcome drink on arrival, Turkish delight in the rooms, arranging us transport to the grandprix. I think we went for a deluxe room after reading the reviews on here and our room was brilliant, lovely big and comfortable bed, really nicely decorated and very quiet. Hope to come back to Istanbul for longer and I will definitely stay here again when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, Enjoy and Smile :)”
Reviews.Author: Mirna3779
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this hotel...its location is great it's next to the Arasta bazar and 5 minutes away from important sites and the tramway station...it's a calm neighborhood. What i liked the most and made my stay worthwhile was the kind hospitality of the owner Mr Fatih and all the staff...they are all very helpful, kind and always smiling. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The atmosphere is very cozy that it really felt like home...i stayed 5 days and i wish i could have stayed more. So for me, Best Point Hotel is really Best Hotel Ever !! :))

Reviews.Title: “This hotel transformed our visit to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Christine064
Reviews.Content: Ours was a first time visit to Istanbul with a wide ranging family group consisting of myself and my husband who are both pensioners ( he has health and mobility problems), my 28 year old son and his new Turkish wife and our two grandchildren age 8 and 13 (who are not too keen on sightseeing.) It was also the hottest time of the year with temperatures in the 40s and high humidity, so I was a bit nervous about how it would go.A good start was that the hotel sent a minibus free of charge to meet us at the airport. When we arrived at the hotel we were delighted to find that it was situated in the heart of the old part of the city, a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque. We were greeted as we stepped out of the minibus by the owner/manager and from that moment on he was around 24 /7 to meet our needs.He sat us down in the courtyard, gave us free cold drinks, and laid on some light refreshments After seeing our rooms , which were all of a standard higher than I had expected in a small hotel (minibar, slippers, jacuzzi, hamam and very effective aircon) he talked us through the services the hotel could offer and made suggestions as to what we might want to do and see given we were only staying for 3 nights. We signed up for quite an expensive day tour which he suggested because it didn't include the things we could walk to, but took us to some of the key sights further afield in the city which we wouldn't have been able to reach without a car. It proved to be an excellent choice, with something for everyone including a 2 hour boat trip on the Bosporous which, along with hopping in and out of the airconditioned coach between sights, kept us reasonably cool on a sweltering day which would have defeated us if we had been out and about on our own on foot. In the evening the hotel offered a free chauffer driven service to and from a range of restaurants in the city. I was a bit suspicious at first thinking that perhaps they would be overpriced , but the only tiime we got ripped off was the one night when we didn't use this service and struck out on our own.The breakfast at the hotel had a wide range of dishes so there was something for everyone and could have been taken on the roof terrace, but we didn't do that as the steps were too narrow and steep for my husband. However he did manage to climb up there one day for a sandwich lunch and the views were great. All the staff in the hotel were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble, ranging from offering to go to the chemist for my husband when he discovered he had forgotten his insulin needles and laying on a driver to take us round on our last day to places we still wanted to see but couldn't walk to. By the last day it felt as if we had all known each other for years and the hotel was like a home from home. All of this came at a very reasonable price. We had the best and most expensive rooms in the hotel which worked out at about Â£38 per head per night , including breakfast. We all agreed that it was the hotel and the service they gave us that had turned a potentially hot and stressful 4 day sightseeing trip into a relaxing and enjoyable experience for us all, especially our grandchildren who had had doubts about Istanbul as part of their summer holiday,but left with great memories and thoroughly enjoyed one of their first hotel experiences..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, wonderful location, rooms, and good value”
Reviews.Author: ckdexterhaven11
Reviews.Content: Best point has a fantastic location, a helpful staff, and very comfortable and attractive rooms. The top floor suite, with a full patio, a beautiful mosque view, and a private hamam and shower, is also a great value -- much less expensive than similar suites in the area. The room is a bit small for a suite, but still very nice. I liked almost everything about Best Point. The breakfast is disappointing, however. There is a very wide variety of items, but the freshness and quality is not as high as other breakfasts I had in Turkey. I also found that the staff initially was very friendly and helpful--but mostly when trying to get me to go to what appear to be sponsored tours or sights (perhaps they get a commission for these?). When they discovered I was interested in the fee-charging services they were recommending, they became less helpful and less friendly during the rest of my stay. They were still professional and polite and I have no complaints, it just changed from exceptional service to good, but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect base in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: emndenver
Reviews.Content: There are too many good choices in this area so it's tough to go wrong if you do your research. However, I am happy that I bet on Hotel Best Point as I was well cared for throughout my stay in Istanbul. For once, the pictures on the hotel site were accurate portrayals of the property. And the reviews of service at Best Point were spot on. I wasn't bothered with a long spiel on potential tours at check in, but the staff was always available to answer questions and give advice. The AC was absolutely frigid, which was nice when recovering from a long day of sightseeing. WiFi signal in room was strong. Breakfast was extensive and lacking nothing, all items were fresh and tasty. No outside noise except for children playing marbles in the alley during the day. As I had a first floor room, I was able to sit on a small patio to enjoy a light snack while listening to call to prayer in the late afternoon. Very peaceful. Hope to return to Hotel Best Point on my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “It is indeed the "BEST POINT" to start your visit in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Alexandru_C
Reviews.Content: From the beginning we had Fatih's support and we trusted in hi's recommendations, and it was a wise choice.
