The hotel, the service, the cleanliness and the friendliness of staff were excellent. The advice and support we have received to descover Istanbul was priceless. It was a week-long holiday that left us with so many pleasant memories. It is the third time we visit Turkey and, as always, we returned with a deep respect and admiration for everything the Turks could do in their country. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Plush and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GlobalEata
Reviews.Content: The service was very cordial. We were greeted with tea and turkish delights. Has excellent view of the Blue Mosque. The rooms are very nice and decorated with mosaics. My husband said the bed was the most comfortable one he's slept in for the past two weeks of traveling. The breakfast had a wide selection and offeref omelettes free of charge. Only down side is there is no elevator but a little exercise is not bad. We got a free room upgrade.

Reviews.Content: Ä±lk once fatÄ±h beye cok tesekkurler hotelÄ±nde gecÄ±rdÄ±gÄ±mÄ±z 4 gun bÄ±zÄ± cok Ä±yÄ± agÄ±rladÄ±.her sekÄ±lde yardÄ±m ettÄ± ve hepÄ±mÄ±z cok memnun kaldÄ±k hotel calÄ±sanlarÄ± da cok guler yuzlu bence Ä±stanbula gÄ±dÄ±lÄ±pte kalÄ±nacak en Ä±yÄ± hotel.basarÄ±larÄ±n devamÄ±nÄ± dÄ±lÄ±yoruz ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TavyNicol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days in Best Point Hotel and we were very impressed by four things: - very useful turistic information offered by the staff - very clean room - the terrace view - kindness of the staff They know english language very well and they gave us many important information about the city, people, good places for shopping. We are very pleased about the services at Best Point Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: buzzlog
Reviews.Content: Umit did a great job while the owner was on his honeymoon. He made sure that we got around town without any issues and we got what we needed in the room. He was very friendly and helpful. When he found out that we were celebrating our anniversary, he surprised us with some wine, cheese and fruits in our room when we got back in our room. The rooms were clean and they had everything you need, including a dental kit. The porter was very helpful as well. The hotel is 2 mins walk behind the Blue Mosque and it's very safe to walk around even late in the night. It's surrounded by restaurants and stores. It's very lively. We'll definitely stay at Best Point next time we're in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “It is adequate.”
Reviews.Author: tor03
Reviews.Content: This place has many positives but also several negatives. Overall I would say the place is adequate but not outstanding. The location is great and the service is good. The place is fairly clean, although they only wash the bedlinens and towels every two days if that matters to you. Fatih, the owner, is very nice but will try to sell you a Bosphorus tour as soon as you arrive. This can be a bit too much after arriving right after a long day of travel. The city map they give you is useless- it is a very zoomed out view of the city. Of course, they have a good map for sale for 3 euros. I think it would be nice if they gave you a map that you can actually use. The room: The price exceeds the value for the deluxe room. I would recommend an economy room if you stay here. Water was completely shut off in my room twice: once when I wanted to brush my teeth and another time when I wanted to shower before leaving the room. Interestingly it was only shut off for about 15 minutes each time so I did not even bother complaining. The breakfast: The breakfast has a lot of variety, but that does not mean quality. I arrived one morning at 7:45am (15 minutes after breakfast opening) and the lights were shut off but everything was sitting out. The food was covered in plastic but had condensation. It makes me wonder how long it had already been sitting out. The coffee is stale and barely drinkable. If you want fresh juice, get out your money because not everything at breakfast is free.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to relax with a stunning view!”
Reviews.Author: bcw5727
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, helpful and gracious. The blue mosque suite had a stunning view from my private balcony. There was also a rooftop balcony to relax for breakfast or in the evening. Everyone there made me feel welcome. They offered directions and advice for sightseeing, and at the end of the day I was welcomed back as the door wss opened for me! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good and best point hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salahunreal
Reviews.Content: We've visited Istanbul for the 3rd time and this time was most pleasant visit. since booking for 10 days in the hotel, a ride from the airport was offered and you fell like VIP in that vehicle. Very warm welcoming by the Manager Fatih. Tea and Turkish delight on arrival with recommendation from Fatih where to go and how to spend the 10 days. The room was clean and well organized. the house keeper cleaned it everyday and each day she was changing the bed sheets and making it looks different every time. It was funny though. The breakfast was more than great. everything almost there and didn't feel that there was something missing. From the location of the hotel we managed to go by walking to many places. The internet was not bad, I managed to do all my stuff and downloading movies and so. it was slow comparing with mine at home but was enough for me there. Mostly quite but sometimes you can hear when people on stairs but it didn't bother us that much. Absolutely recommended. Salah & Inas

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: BJW84
Reviews.Content: We loved the Best Point Hotel! When we arrived Faith,the manager/owner, met us with a cold beer, Turkish Delights and provided us with an orientation of the hotel and the city, along with suggestions and options for tours etc. No pressure, just really good information. Our room was perfect, on main floor in the back building with easy access to courtyard and street. The room was spacious, deluxe double, with very comfortable king bed, couch and two small chairs...nice to relax in room after a long day of sightseeing! It is in a great location, right in the middle of everything but nice and quiet. Easy walking distance to every major tourist site and lots of options for dinner and drinks. Huge breakfast served in lower level..more than enough and well presented. Staff were fantastic, would do anything to make your stay enjoyable. Our friends were at the Empress Zoe and wished they'd booked with us at Best Point!! Book here for a wonderful stay..you will not be sorry. Best regards to the helpful (and handsome) Faith!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Looked great - If only we got to stay there”
Reviews.Author: ben1986s
Reviews.Content: So, I booked this hotel after reading the review on TA and was looking forward to my stay there. Arrived after a LONG bus ride (12hrs), and were greeted by an extremely friendly gentleman in reception. He talked about the room, and said that the economy room we had booked would be on the ground floor (?) and mumbled something about a problem with the air conditioning, so we would be staying in 'Block B'. We were taken to 'Block B' which was actually the Angel's Home Hotel round the corner. My suspicion is that they were able to move us to this hotel, and resell our room for a higher price. The other hotel did not seem anywhere near as clean or modern as the Best Point Hotel, but as we were only staying for a night and were shattered, we did not bother to complain. It was ok, but nothing to write home about. I could not recommend booking this hotel to anyone else, as you may not actually stay where you are expecting to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: JaVaVoom
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at about 11pm at night. The service was great. Was greeted with some Turkish tea and turkish Delight. Was immediately given all the information regarding trips and places to visit etc etc before even checking in, which I didn't mind too much because it was very useful advice!! Fatih was really friendly and I had no problems communicating with him. The room we had (Double Room with a jacuzzi) was really nice, and very well decorated. The location of the hotel was great, about 3-4mins walk to the Blue Mosque. The hotel staff were very friendly and always willing to help. The breakfast was great, especially their chocolate and hazelnut spreads!! To be honest, all the other good stuff people on TA have previously mentioned have been spot on. I would definitely recommend this place. Now the negative aspects. The bathroom cleaning wasn't 100% great in the aspect that a couple of things (like bathroom oils/soaps) weren't replaced. The internet was extremely slow and really annoying, so no point going on there. The last thing is from the perspective of a muslim. Stay away from their omelettes!!.... I'm not too sure if the kitchen staff or Fatih are aware of this, or understand this, but you cannot cook ham and vegetarian food in the same utensils/oil. I tried explaining this to the staff but their english was not very good.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: rach1979
Reviews.Content: we flew into the airport which is further out, however there is hotel transfers from there.On arrival to the hotel we where greeted by a friendly receptionist.He explained istanbut to us and we got a cheeky drink to add to it. It was a delayed honeymoon and the room we got was lovely, with fresh fruit and wine for us, a lovely touch! The best bit of the hotel was the roof top terrace, with stunning views of the blue mosque and the golden horn. Each late afternoon we'd go up there with our books and just take in the views!!! The location is excellent and plenty of bars/restaurants within 2 minutes walk. My husband recommends having a Turkish shave! Fantastic hotel, with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point was a great find. I'm glad we stayed there!”
Reviews.Author: chesterwaverly
Reviews.Content: I booked Best Point because of the reviews it had received here on TA. And my family wasn't disappointed. Before we arrived, coming in from Bodrum, we'd been in regular contact with Fatih, the owner. He helped arrange transport from the airport, which was there when we arrived, and they were very pleasant people, even putting on a DVD for kids to watch as we drove to the hotel. I'd read here that when you arrive they greet you with a drink. I wondered if this would be a trick, if we'd be charged for the drinks when we checked out, but it was a complete demonstration of Turkish hospitality, and we were not charged a lira. Fatih took a few minutes to talk with us, even speaking in Russian to my Kazakh wife! He gave us some tips and suggestions, and then we were off to our room. The rooms are exactly like you see them on the website. They aren't large, but they are very comfortable and nicely decorated. We were in a standard triple, and it was fine for us. The beds were very comfortable, and the glass in the window was thick enough that the call to prayer from the nearby Blue Mosque was hardly heard. Nice shower with good pressure. We approached Fatih with some requests for directions to a few things and he was very helpful telling us how to get where we needed to be. One of the older reviews said something about the front desk staff trying to push a Bosphorus tour, we never felt we were being pushed to do anything. If we asked, we were helped. In fact, this was something that really made an impression on us. Fatih and his staff bent over backwards to help us at all times, even offering us a warm drink when we were caught in a downpour and came in soaked. The breakfast was fantastic (my first real coffee for breakfast in days), and they even carry your trays up four flights of stairs to the terrace so you can eat overlooking the sea. When we checked out, I wondered if there might be some surprises in the bill, but there was nothing at all - just the normal charges, even though we'd had several cups of tea outside of the normal breakfast time. Also, the entire hotel has wireless, which is good and fast. I really have nothing negative to say about our experience at Best Point. It is a good hotel, with a good location, and a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, great value and fabulous location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: joy027
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. First night in single beds (Romantic getaway) But put into Comfortable Double room for the next 5. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was the best we had, compared to our previous 2 week stay in various hotels. The staff were always available and always helpful and full of smiles. Location was great so close to all the tourist spots and lots of good eating places close by. Boutique hotel that I would recommend to anyone going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service for Selective Traveler”
Reviews.Author: MayGoEZ
Reviews.Content: Having worked over a decade in luxury hotels in USA, I have acquired a distinctive eye for hotels that are unrated-best kept secrets. Best Point Hotel is a first class boutique hotel that surpassed my expectations. The rooms were clean and the decor was modern. It is rare to find hotel staff that is customer service oriented and can handle business in an orderly and professional manner. No matter what question we asked, the staff was willing to assist with our travel plans. The staff was professional and ascertained that guest inquiries were not only addressed, but went beyond the call of duty to get answers promptly.The hotel staff was very knowledgeable of the city, sites, restaurants and other businesses, and every request we made was granted with a smile! It was such a delight to get straight answers without hesitation and pretense. The hotel is situated in a great location near the major sites in the old town and only a few blocks from restaurant row. The staff also made reservations for us to tour other sites and arranged transportation to and from the airport for a reasonable rate. I highly recommend this hotel to travelers who desire first class customer service, and want to feel welcomed!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point is the BEST PERIOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Philip31
Reviews.Content: Two Friends and I stayed at the Best Point Hotel Istanbul from May 28-Jun 2. This hotel is a gem. The staff are great. They are so friendly and helpful and the Hotel room was very clean. Breakfast has lots of choices, and we loved the rooftop terrace with great views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. All for an incredible price, I feel. Location is walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and Sultanahamet area. Thank You so much Fatih and staff for a great stay!!!!! Philip, Jacqueline and Brent.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT !”
Reviews.Author: pauly62
Reviews.Content: We were met upon arrival by Fatih the manager, checked in and offered a cold drink. The room was lovely, the breakfast buffet was extensive and the staff could not do enough for you. The hotel could not be more central, within walking distance to many sites and restaurants. On the last day Fatih upgraded us to the Blue Mosque Terrace room, it had stunning views over the mosque and city, and a lovely terrace. We will definately go back to the hotel and would recomend it too anybody ! Thank you so much for making our 4 night stay so perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dane2400
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel in central but quiet location, close to the major sights. The jacuzzi was very small though. The best was the rooftop terrace where there is a view over the Bosporus and the Blue Mosque. The staff is very helpful indeed. We could select our breakfast and put it on a tray and the staff would carry the tray up to the rooftop. Very recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Sultahmet part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DKissinger
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Turkey and Istanbul. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be in very comfortable hotel in an ideal location and have service that is excellent! From the pick up at the airport to greetings in the lobby to the delivery back to the airport, friendly service is Best Point's finest attribute. Fatih and his team work very hard at making your vacation one you will remember with joy. The hotel is located very near the Blue Mosque in an ideal location to visit the sights of Sultanhmet. From the roof top patio you can enjoy a drink and view upon the Bosphorous Sea and the Blue Mosque. Conveniently next door is an excellent travel agency named YUME Travel. Agent Remzi Deliduman will tend to you every travel need.

Reviews.Title: “Best service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rkrantz
Reviews.Content: Fahti and the staff are very service oriented. When you arrive, they sit in the lobby with some tea and get to know you. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The roof has an incredible view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorous Sea. Great for happy hour! Within walking distance of many sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Excellent Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: LondonSpacehopper
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant staff, excellent value for money, superb location, great views from the terrace. Less than five minutes walk from main sites. Breakfast ok - best bit was the great fresh fruit salad which was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: gl102876
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I had a very good stay at the Best Point Hotel.The service and breakfast was very good,with a great variety of food to choose from. Friendly staff, clean and spacious room.I could not be more satisfied with the hotel. The owner is always there and was really helpful with info and tips.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Alice1234058
Reviews.Content: We originally scheduled the Best Point for 4 nights, but with the Volcanic Ash over Europe, we stayed an extra 3 nights. Fatih couldn't have been more helpful with checking flights, extending our stay and making us feel very welcome. He also had some very good advice for tours. The staff went out of there way to make us confortable as well. The room size was very good and it was very clean. They have a rooftop with a view of the Bosphorus and the Blue Mosque which was quite romantic. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Not missing anything if you don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: ucelle
Reviews.Content: On the advice of previous TA reviews, we made sure we booked a "standard" room (through expedia). We however think we got an economy room - it was on the first floor in the main building and absolutely tiny. We even had to request for a TV receiver. The reception is noisy well into midnight and we can hear everything from our room. There were many choices at breakfast, but it lacks quantity (e.g. 6 pieces of each cold cut is hardly going to last the b/fast service). Many choices around the same area, no need to go for this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everyminute of our stay !”
Reviews.Author: emby1
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for us, with panaramic views of the Blue Mosque and the Sea, which is where we wanted to be. After a very filling buffet, breakfast all the great places to visit are a walking distance away or if you fancy a tram away for 2.00 Tlr. Fatih the owner was a great host and interacts with all his guests as do all the other staff who are always willing to help or guide you with any questions you have.The hotel can arrange tours for you and once agreed you can guarantee it will be done . Rooms were beautiful and cosy and my family felt at home , thank you to all at Best Point , would happily recommend it to family / friends and all other readers...Yakoob & Family , UK

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulNetherlands
Reviews.Content: My father and I had a very good stay at the Best Point Hotel.The service and breakfast was very good, friendly staff. We can reconmend the Bosperus trip wich was arranged through the hotel. You will get a good overview of Istanbul in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind”
Reviews.Author: meliras
Reviews.Content: I have a different experience with this Hotel. We did not stay there yet but i recieved very nice attitude during my reservation process . .. we had to change our trip plans several times ...and each time , they were very helpfull , very understanding and very professional with my questions and wishes. I am already sure that i will have a pleasant stay in may 2010 at that hotel and looking forward to be there

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Gilberto40
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked by reading the reviews from others here. I could not be more satisfied with the hotel. Our suite was just wonderful. Breakfast is very nice with a great variety of food to choose from. The owner is always there and was really helpful with info and tips. Employees did their best to help us. They have several providers of cable/sattelite TV and you just need to ask them to connect with the best one you need. It is so very close to Blue and Sophia Mosques. Also close to the tram so you can get around easily.

Reviews.Title: “What else ?”
Reviews.Author: matosFrance
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights there. All the staff were really nice, the room pretty and the breakfast buffet really good (but why playing this clubbing music ???). Also the Manager gives us really good advices about Istanbul...all this close right in the old city....great great great. Toma and Christine

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly helpful staff, comfortable rooms, would want to stay again”
Reviews.Author: froggg
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Best Point. this hotel is in a very good location for the main sites in central Istanbul and in the evenings just walk down the street to see a great selection of restaurants. The reception manager was helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. We would definintely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: ZahShah
Reviews.Content: My stay in best point hotel was with no regrets. Everything from the day i checked in till the day i checked out was perfect. All staff were polite and extremely helpful especially the owner Mr Fatih. He gave us valuable information on where to eat, where to shop where to visit and he was very hospitable...The hotel itself was in an excellent location within a stone's throw away from all the historical sites and there was so many cafes and restaurants around.This hotel is definately highly recommended....

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Istanbul By a Country Mile!”
Reviews.Author: notreadytogo
Reviews.Content: Well after reading the reviews on TA we were expecting an above average experience, And we were not let down, after staying in many "Smaller" Hotels around the world, this one really pushes all the right buttons 1: Location - Minutes walk to all the sites but in a quiet location with plenty of restaruants. You cannot ask more than that 2: Staff - These people would not be out of place in a world class 5* hotel (And in fact I wish they had been at a lot of the 5* hotels I had stayed at in the past!) nothing too much trouble, always a friendly hello and smile, whatever you wanted or needed was available without fuss (Top Class without exception) 3: Rooms - Clean and good quality (OK a little small you have to wiggle round the bed at times), but its a room to sleep in not to hold a dance party). The rooms are well appointed and even the minibar prices are not excessive (5euro for apleasant bottle of wine) 4: Services - Wifi worked and was quick enough for emails and surfing, Breakfast was plentiful fresh and well presented with quality service. All i can say is stay anywhere else and you will wish you were here. Its not often I gush on about a hotel (Lets face it you are paying to stay there so expect service) , but sometimes it is so much btter than average it deserves a special mention - This place falls at the top o that catagory. Sure I have missed something, but sure you get the picture from this and other reviews, Don't stay at a chain hotel, pass your holiday budget to these hard working local indpendents. you will not regret it Vicky & Richard

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: KualaLumpurSuec
Reviews.Content: I felt that the staff were really brilliant in making me feel at home in a strange land. They really bent over on some occasions to make my friends and i feel comfortable to the extent of cooking us eggs the way we like it and getting us on a good sight-seeing tour. The breakfast spread was good as well (but not very varied, the only downside). But the class act in best point was the room i got which was really comfy and clean. There was no shortage of hot water, which was great considering the weather when we came (snowing and windy). The location is really quite central, 5-10 mins to the nearest tram stop Sultanahmet and some of the best tourist spots in Istanbul - blue mosque, hagia sophia and topkapi palace. Nuff said....Had an AWESOME time in Istanbul, Thanks Fatih, Umit, Nusrat, Jack, etc. I will definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Best 3Star Hotel In Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: izz05
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Istanbul on 23rd to 27th Jan 2010 we stayed at BestPoint Hotel in Sultanahmet.Mr Fatih and staff were very sincere and helpful with our needs.The hotel room was very clean and the room that we stayed was spacious for the 3 of us.This is our 4th trip to Istanbul and by far the best hotel in term of service....believed me!The hotel location was also very near to main tourist attractions.Will be staying there again and well done for Mr Fatih and staff for giving us a good experiance to remember.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: davidheaton66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Poin Hotel after reading the reviews. A great place to stay. We were picked up at the airport and warmly welcomed by Fatih and his staff. We could not have stayed anywhere better and we were looked after like family. Nothing was too much trouble. A great hotel,fantastic location,wonderful breakfast buffet but above all the lovely kind people who run this hotel make you feel special. I will definitely stay here again and will reccomend it to all my friends when they choose to visit Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret...”
Reviews.Author: ACitizenoftheWorld88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week there, we loved it. It located at the most convenient location for tourists, just behind the Blue Mosque, and a lot of restaurants around. Hotel is very new, in great condition. Our room was bit of small, other than that, everything was just wonderful. The owner Fatih and his staff provided great service. Tip: If you want to book a tour, book it through the hotel, youâ€™ll have must better price than travel agencies around.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Raphael-and-Family
Reviews.Content: The owner and manager Fatih is a young architect by training and a gracious host by vocation. He converted his grandfather house in the old city of Istanbul, litterally at a stone's throw from the blue mosque, into a small hotel. The rooms are simply yet very tastefully decorated and foreseen of all modern conveniences, including AC, minibar and "power showers". The hotel is foreseen of WiFi access throughout. Everything is spotlessly clean. The breakfast buffet is varied and generous. Fatih and his young team will advise and assist in arranging just about anything, from transportation and tours, to shows and restaurants. The prices are very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “BEST POINT - THE RIGHT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: jbmadigan
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent a week in Istanbul and stayed at the Best Point Hotel. This was an excellent place to stay. Fatih, the owner and staff were excellent and very friendly. They offered good suggestions and the rooms were clean and spacious. If considering Istanbul, then I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great service, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KellyAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 day trip to Istanbul and we stayed at the Best Point for our entire trip. Firstly, want to say, that this hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. You are walking distance to everything, including a great little strip of restaurants literally just up the road. Not to mention, walking distance to all the major sites in Sultan Ahmet, the tram, and your about a 10-15min walk to the Galata bridge (which we walked to many times). So, if your looking for location, look no further. Service was excellent, Fatih is quite the businessman, he's got drive and ambition and its because of this that his hotel is so great! The entire staff were helpful and very nice, he's got a great team of people working there. Breakfast was DELICIOUS!!!! I personally loved the selection of cheeses, olives and Turkish pastries and desserts.....YUMMY!!! The food is plentiful and just enough to get you through your morning. There isn't one negative thing to say about this hotel, if your looking for great service, a great location, well balanced rooms, then I'd say you need to stay here! You won't regret it. HAPPY NEW YEAR to all of the staff at Best Point best of luck for the coming year!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, professional little hotel 5 minutes from Blue Mosque, etc.”
Reviews.Author: evotz2
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here! Rooms are just like shown in pics - new, spacious, classy decor. Lovely jacuzzi in bathroom. Breakfast is hearty buffet spread downstairs. Owner Fatih & staff are friendly & helpful, but like all Istanbul-ers, misunderstandings in English is common. Hotel is is on a quiet corner literally 2 streets behind Arasta Bazaar (attached to Blue Mosque) and easy 5 minute walk to it and 10-15 to the other major historic sites. Hotel can arrange Bosporus boat trips and a good, historic, non-touristy Turkish bath/hamaam for 50 TL. Aso, free Wi-FI! Lastly, the staff gave us cookies and drinks to go after we checked out since breakfast was not open yet!

Reviews.Title: “The discretion and the peace of your home, the service and the comfort of a royal palace!”
Reviews.Author: marameo64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Best Point Hotel 4 nights, with my colleague, during a business trip. Fatih and his staff were nice and professional in their service. The hotel is clean and tidy, very friendly and is located in a strategic position in the district of Sultanahmet. The room is well decorated and equipped by all the necessary, elegant and quiet, the bed comfortable and cozy. Sanitary and bathroom always clean and the staff is so discreet and professional. Breakfast is simply superb, with many dishes both sweet and salty, even "too much", but this is really a pleasure: a good breakfast helps starting our day so much happy. I was very well and my next time in Istanbul it will be a pleasure to book at Best Point Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Top Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wk747
Reviews.Content: we spent our last vacation with our friends in Istanbul and we choose the Best Point hotel which was clearly a satisfaction. we checked in 6 in the morning and we got our early check in prepared by the hotel without any charges or even the need to ask for it. they did understand what we need at this time in the morning while they are able to give us our booked room. the hotel is in a cozy area near Aya Sofia and Blue mosque and some nice Bazar. you will like the rooms because they are well decorated compared to other hotels in the area. the staff is more than friendly, and make you feel like you know them since ever. those people have potential specially their manager Mr. Fatih who tries not to miss any request you ask for. Thank You Best Point... we will be back again..

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable boutique hotel with tasteful Turkish decor, friendly service and an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kausha25
Reviews.Content: We were warmly welcomed on arrival by Fatih and were offered complementary drinks while we filled out the forms. I had e-mailed Fatih before my arrival and he had booked us on a full day Bospherous tour ,much less than the advertised brochure rates and it was very enjoyable. Even though it was a smaller hotel, it is beautifully and tastefully decorated with typical Turkish mosaic and furniture. Rooms were comfortable, very clean and tastefully done. We were upgraded to a deluxe room the first day. This room had a beautiful large bathroom. Even the standard room we stayed in was very comfortable. The only thing was the shower stall was a bit small but it was not an issue for us. The buffet breakfast had quite a spread and the hotel was walking distance to most of the main tourist attractions. Lots of shops and restaurants within a minute's walk. Fatih and his staff were very friendly and helpful. We are planning to visit Istanbul again for a longer stay and will definitely stay at Best Point Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLANT FAMILY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: taylerjam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed close to all amenities, friendly staff, clean and excellant hotel and bedrooms. Huge selection for breakfast and very attractive on the outside. Well worth a stay and visit to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character and authentic Turkish decor. Fabulous location and staff”
Reviews.Author: AlpineTravellers
Reviews.Content: The staff were welcoming and friendly. Always greeting you on your return and offering you tea, coffee or water. The room was exquisitely decorated with quality inclusions. The location is a 3 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and Hipperdrome. Lots of good little eateries at hand. A very large choice of food at the breakfast buffet. We stayed in two rooms. The first was small but adequate the second was much more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding for cleanliness, friendliness, location and service”
Reviews.Author: NoosRugby
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this hotel too highly. It is in a superb location, five minutes walk from main sights and with plenty of good places to eat from budget to indulgent within a couple of minutes walk, in an atmospheric part of town. We were greeted with a drink, made to feel hugely welcome, and the room was lovely - spacious, spotlessly clean and very quiet. We had lots of help with how to get the best out of our stay, the staff were interested and courteous, from the front desk through to cleaning and dining staff, but never intrusive. The view from the roof terrace is stunning, to sit up there as the light fades overlooking the bospherous and the blue mosque whilst evening prayers are called was magical. We had our fourteen year old daughter with us and felt perfectly happy for her to return to the hotel alone during the day. We would like to thank all the staff again for such a wonderful stay. We would not think of staying anywhere else if we returned to Istanbul and this hotel deserves its success. Thank you! Chris and Steph Seeley

Reviews.Title: “Our second home”
Reviews.Author: YakamozTurkey
Reviews.Content: It was just likea second home. Fatih and staff excelled in the way they looked after us from the time we arrived till we departed. Excellent location for sightseeing. We will certainly stay again when we go back to Istanbul. We wish Fatih and his staff every success.

Reviews.Title: “After a long search, the Best Point really stood out”
Reviews.Author: Panchoy
Reviews.Content: We showed up in Istanbul without reservations, so I really felt fortunate to be able to get five nights here. Out of the many hotels I checked in the area, the Best Point was certainly the best value for the Lira. While all rooms in Istanbul tend to be on the small side, the room we had for the first three nights was large, spacious and well decorated. On the last two nights, we had to switch to a smaller room, which was a bit cramped. The breakfast buffet had an incredible selection. As this was our first stop on our tour and Turkey, we found the staff very helpful with our many questions. I did find the area very touristy, though, and next time I would stay in another part of town. However, with that said, you really have to get away from the Blue Mosque and Ayia Sofya to make that happen.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CruzdelSur
Reviews.Content: The Best Point was a great choice for our stay in Istanbul. Fantastic location with the added bonus of having Fatih, who runs the hotel, giving us the best tips on where to eat and how to maximize our time to see the sites of Istanbul. We stayed in the new block B in one of the Deluxe Triples. The room was very spacious, always clean and very comfortable. We were too busy visiting the sites to use the jacuzzi but it's there for anyone who wants it! Breakfast at the hotel is also a great experience, absolutely delicious. Fatih also recommended dining at Fener and Kalamar in the fish market. Both proved to be the best dining experiences of our stay and the atmosphere in the market area is not only fun, but unique. Free transportation to and from the restaurants was organized by reception. The Best Point provides great value for money but its biggest asset is the friendly service and great advice provided by Fatih and his staff. If anything isn't quite right , just ask Fatih and he will make it perfect! The Best Point was the perfect place to make our family trip fantastic. It 's not easy pleasing mum, but we did it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point; Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: FairMaid008
Reviews.Content: Best Location: A stone's throw from the Blue Mosque; Streets full of restaurants and cafes within yards; a couple of minutes walk from Istanbul's excellent tramway service. Best Hotel: The hotel is spotless and the staff are friendly and will make every effort to help you. Fatih and Umit who man reception are both lovely guys and can speak English well and are really helpful at answering questions and giving good advice on Best Value on the things you might buy (I would have saved a small fortune if i had only spoken to Fatih before I had bought that Pashmina!). Our room was not large, but was perfectly formed, with a huge bed and all the furniture you would expect in a hotel room. We had booked the Economy Double (which is located beside reception) but because we were staying for 9 nights we had been given a free upgrade where we had access to a private mini courtyard, with table and chairs for two: Perfect! There was efficient air conditioning and the bathroom shower was the best we had ever come across in any hotel, anywhere! Spacious, with a power shower with real blasting power, which could be set to any temperature you wished it to be. Best Breakfast: A huge range of options, including cheeses, meats, biscuits and cakes and almost any spread you could think of (including honeycomb honey!) for your fresh bread and rolls, or adding to your cereal, or yoghurt. Freshly made Omlettes were a choice, with a variety of filler options. The lovely lady who supervises the kitchen takes an obvious pride in ensuring that the everything looks and tastes good. A touch I was especially grateful for (and almost impossible to get anywhere else in Istanbul) was a decent mug size cup for the coffee, with a pot of hot milk to add to taste, Early morning Bliss! There was also a variety of teas to choose from. If you wished you could choose your breakfast and have it taken up to the delightful roof terrace by a very fit staff as it's four flights up! However, the view is the Best, with the Blue Mosque on one side and sea views on the other three. You can also spot other roof terraces, who are sharing the same view, but which cost at least twice and often three times as much as the Best Point. The only thing they offer is more space; for value I would say that Best Point is small, but perfectly formed!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point was good value for our money; it met all our needs and expectations.”
Reviews.Author: mean_cue
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days in Istanbul and stayed at Best Point. Because we chose this hotel based on the comments from Trip Advisor, we believe itâ€™s important that we provide a pragmatic review of the hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with Best Point. We booked a room in â€œB blockâ€�, which is the new wing of the hotel (completed last Aug, 2009), based on the suggestion of Fatih, the young, energetic owner of the hotel. It cost slightly more but it was very much worth it, particularly since we were here for a week. The room was large â€“ it had a king size bed, a small sofa, a table and chairs, lots of closet space and drawers and we still had a lot of room to move around. And best of all, the bathroom was huge! It was modern, functional but with a nice touch of Izmik tiles to remind one that youâ€™re in Turkey. The location of the hotel is very central â€“ literally, a few minutesâ€™ walk to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Because itâ€™s in the heart of Sultahnamet area, restaurants and shops abound. Although they have a lot of variety for breakfast, we preferred having an omelet freshly prepared upon request (at no additional cost). The hotel provided free internet and the wireless connection in the room was very strong, which was an added bonus. The staff are very attentive to our needs and accommodating. After a long day of sightseeing, they will always offer you a complimentary drink (tea, water, etc.) if you linger in the lobby. They can appear to be over eager at times, providing suggestions for what to see in Istanbul. Theyâ€™re not pushy though so you can choose to follow their suggestions or not. Weâ€™ve learned, however, that this is part of the â€œcharacterâ€� of Istanbul and we just didnâ€™t let it bother us. At the end of the day, they aim to please. On our final day, we were pleasantly surprised when the staff brought up to our room some cakes, cookies and tea prior to our 5:30 am pick up for our flight out of Istanbul. Altogether, Best Point was good value for our money; it met all our needs and expectations. Thank you to Fatih and the rest of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Hotel, Istanbul - Would Stay Again :)”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler99
Reviews.Content: A Great Time, would stay at Best Point again! Newer, Small Boutique style hotel. Rooms were small, but very clean and safe. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A little out of the way, but very quiet. A bit difficult to find at first, but then it was no problem. Great Roof-top deck with views of Bosphorus Sea and Blue Mosque. We would take bahklava and drinks out at night, and enjoy the views. There is also a patio area. Good Location! Walking distance to Blue Mosque and St Sophia Church. Very central to main street with lots of restaurants and bakeries nearby. Easy to use public transport nearby. Small market next door for water and drinks. Wi-fi in rooms. Not much selection of English speaking channels on tv. Decent free breakfast, but same spread each day. Istanbul is a great city for walking. Bring your walking shoes, and explore the town, the markets, the fishermen/eateries on the Galata Bridge. Take a ferry on the Bosphorus, relaxing and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: DifficultToPlease09
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of small boutique hotels in Sultanahmet (which is a great homebase for a stay in Istanbul), but many of them are not worth their price. The Best Point is a great value. We upgraded to their new block of rooms, which are not facing the street and it was very quiet at night compared to other hotels in the neighborhood. The Best Point has a lovely breakfast, a very helpful and friendly staff, beautiful, clean and comfortable rooms, and is in a perfect location for exploring Istanbul on foot. We stayed at a different hotel in a similar price range the first night and it was really of poor quality and value. The Best Point was so much nicer and more comfortable. We would definitely stay there again. We wish we'd had more money on us on our way out the door to the airport for tips. The staff was so kind and attentive. They brought us fruit and wine one evening just as a kind gesture. Thank you Fatih and staff for a great stay. We would definitely come again! We will let everyone know they should stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “Better options and we found them”
Reviews.Author: RodAustralia
Reviews.Content: If you need paternalistic advice this may be the hotel for you. On the other hand if you are capable of making some basic arrangements for yourself and donâ€™t need to be advised of what is obvious for any guide book there may be better options for you. My wife and I fell into the second category and the initial pleasant and enthusiastic response from the staff waned into aloofness when it became apparent we did not need their advice and or assistance. Not sure about what arrangements they may have had with 3rd party supplies of services, but it did cross our minds that this may have contributed to coolness after a day or two. The power of the internet, we booked the hotel because of positive reviews. Our experience did not align with the majority of the positive reviews. The hotel had trip advisor review page as their home page on the public access computer. Due to my experience at the hotel I will now have a circumspect view of hotels who adopt this arrangement. Our stay was for 5 nights on mid September, I have since been back to Istanbul and have had the privelge of staying at a comparable priced hotel in relative proximity that was far better value for money, with a higher quality of professional service and all in all a fare superior experience. Overrated, overpriced, much better options available. Rod and Jessie - Australia

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: CaLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at Best Point Hotel, the location is great. Every night we walked past the Blue Mosque on our way back to the hotel. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean, a bit small. Breakfast consist of various types of salami, cheese, fruit, lots of spreads, dried cookies and pound cakes. They serve eggs, but only small omelet's, no sunny side or scramble. We paid 115usd for two twin beds. We took the train / tram from the airport, then walked about 8 blocks to the hotel, majority is downhill, on cobble stone streets. We decided to take a shuttle back to the airport and it cost us 5euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Fattabbycat
Reviews.Content: We chose the Best Point for our 40th wedding anniversary after looking at many alternatives. As we were staying for 4 nights we had the benefit of included transfers to & from Ataturk Airport, which was helpful in a city we had not visited before. Our reception by Fatih Yildirim was attentive & helpful, being welcomed with a drink & information. We subsequently found all the other staff to be equally pleasant & obliging. We had the Blue Mosque suite on the 4th floor which was excellent, with a great view of the mosque & a good size terrace. Only a few more stairs took us to the roof terrace with excellent views across the city & the Sea of Marmara. The hotel was very clean & well appointed, situated in a quiet part of Akbiyik Street, very close to many restaurants to choose from for dinner. There was an excellent choice for the buffet breakfast including omelettes made to order, on top of as a large choice of meats & cheese, etc. In short, we have no hesitation in recommending the hotel for its location, staff & quality of accommodation. Only a little further afield was Sultanahmet Square, with several of Istanbul's major sights, a bank of ATMs, more restaurants & a tram stop (70p anywhere, though city coverage is a bit limited). The Topkapi Palace complex was an easy walk away as well. All the major sights were worth seeing, surprisingly apart from the Grand Bazaar, the highlight probably being a half-day boat trip up the Bosphorus, booked through the hotel. Other favourites were the Hagia Sophia, the Egyptian (Spice) Bazaar near Galata Bridge & the Topkapi. On a general note, it is worth checking anywhere in Istanbul not only the cost of anything in numbers, but also the currency symbol, as Turkish Lira, Euros & Dollars all seem to be acceptable. If you assume something is priced in Lira, & it turns out to be in Euros, this effectively doubles the cost! If there was a downside, as the hotel does not have a lift, it would be an inappropriate choice for those with mobility difficulties unless you book a ground floor room. Summarising, an excellent choice for our 4-night break.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: reallyliketraveling
Reviews.Content: The location of the Best Point hotel, just behind the Blue Mosque in old Istanbul, is absolutely perfect. The staff, particularly the manager Fatih, is very friendly and helpful. The roof-top deck provides a great view of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus. The rooms are nicely decorated. Although there were a couple of negatives, we would still use them again and would recommend them. The rooms were on the small side so if spaciousness is a high priority avoid the hotel. There is no elevator which was not a problem for us. Also, while the buffet breakfast seemed expansive, we rated the quality and taste as just OK. All-in-all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Truly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaPotomacMD
Reviews.Content: I feel an obligation to write a review as I have used TripAdvisor for planning many trips and appreciate the comments of others. This hotel lives up to its reviews! Our party recently had a delightful 4 night stay in Best Point Hotel. Upon arrival, we were met promptly at the airport and driven to the hotel. Staff greeted us and we enjoyed a leisurely time of tea and conversation in the lobby before going to our rooms. We happened to arrive at a busy time in late afternoon yet staff was hospitable and unruffled with all. The location in the Sultanahmet is perfect. One can easily walk to the most important sights in Istanbul: the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Tokpaki Palace, Grand Bazaar. The tram is close to the Blue Mosque and makes other areas of the city very accessible. Our rooms, 205, was spacious and the bathroom, luxurious. The breakfast buffet was one of the best of our trip. It was extensive beyond the normal breads, cheese and meat with homemade cookies, cakes, fruit, cereal, and even made to order omelets. The staff is obviously focused on customer service. Each of them was friendly, amazingly helpful and pleasant. Kudos to Fatih, Emrah,and the rest of the staff! Fatih was outstanding in responding to emails during the planning of our visit and had good suggestions for scheduling our days. We found Istanbul to be delightful and the people were exceptionally friendly. Best Point Hotel was a wonderful place to stay! D Foster

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little hotel... in a perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: real-alan
Reviews.Content: Very happy to have found this little gem for our first visit to Istanbul.... the shuttle from the airport was waiting as promised... and Fatih made us extremely welcome (as did all his staff) - it's reasonably priced, and therefore didn't mind that the room we had was a touch small - it was very comfortable.... very close to the Blue Mosque (so be prepared to be woken by the (very loud!) call to prayer at dawn... a couple of minutes walk to the mosque, and to Hagia Sofia (apologies for the spelling!), and handy for the trams down into the city, or along to the Grand Bazaar (which is easily walkable if you're not lazy) Breakfast was plentiful, although my only gripe about the whole hotel experience was the breakfast coffee.... it gets progressively weaker as fresh water is added with a limited amount of additional coffee.... but hey, that's the only thing! A really nice touch was when we were leaving, at the unearthly hour of 5.00am - our alarm call was bang on time, & when we made it downstairs to the car that was waiting, the staff had put out a simple breakfast (coffee & pastries) for us.... oh, and before that, the guest computer was temporarily out of action, but the staff offered to let me use the main computer in reception to do my online check in for the flight home We had a great time & would be very happy to return

Reviews.Title: “Great Locatiom - but take earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: SEFC
Reviews.Content: Good location 5 minutes walk from Blue Mosque etc, but rooms fronting onto the street are very noisy - Avoid room 204 - absolutely tiny

Reviews.Title: “This will always be our Home in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: christian55
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, friendly staff great location and a wonderfull breakfast every morning. Fatih and the rest of the staff really make you feel at home. The rooms are small but very clean and confortable. we usually stay in 5 star hotels with the main issue being the confort of the beds and this little Hotel has nothing to envy in that department. I will recomend this hotel to all my freinds! Thanks again Fatih!!

Reviews.Title: “So So ExperÄ±ence”
Reviews.Author: Tamika_Johnson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just left Best Point after 4 nights. As everyone else mentioned the staff was very frÄ±endly and accommodating. The hotel is close to the major attractions and just a short walk away from the tram line. Here is my list of pros and cons: Pros: Staff is very attentive and strÄ±ve to make you feel at home. Good location. Apple tea Ä±s plentÄ±ful. Had an Ä±ssue wÄ±th the bÄ±ll and Ä±t was taken care of wÄ±th no problems. Cons: (and these are not thÄ±ngs that are the staffÂ´s fault) The walls are very thÄ±n. You can hear every door that opens, every conversatÄ±on that Ä±s had EVERYTHING.
