Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, with great service..”
Reviews.Author: Nick_Monger
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here due to the great reviews and recommendation on TripAdvisor. Prior to our trip we were a little dubious that an independant hotel could carry such high aclaim and that somehow there had been false ratings. Immediately after arrival we were relieved to find that each positive review is well deserved and earned from hard work and exemplary customer care. We had airport transfers included in our hotel rate and the Mercedes people carrier was there to greet us (even though we were delayed by over an hour by the Turkish passport control) Our driver was very friendly and drove us (2 adults, 2 small children) very safely to our hotel. On arrival Fatih (hotel mngr) arranged tea and soft drinks + some fantastic Turkish delight. After getting our keys we were led to our room which was VERY clean and nicely furnished. Throughout our 4 day visit the hotel staff bent over backwards to ensure we were looked after. The hotel is centrally located in the Sultanahmet district so all major sights are within a 10 / 15 minute walk. They even arranged for a driver to take us to one of the hospitals to visit a sick relative - they happily waited for over an hour in the car park whilst we made the visit and then drove us back to the hotel. I have stayed in many major chain hotels throughout the globe, and this one definately stands out as one of the best. Book here with confidence and let Fatih and his team look after you...you will not be dissapointed. Nick, Anita, Noah & Christopher.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: keltoshe
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic four night stay at the Best Point Hotel. We have traveled to many cities, and therefore stayed a numerous hotels. This hotel has to be one of the "Best". Fatih and his brilliant staff make this boutique hotel, the only place to stay in Istanbul. Fatih is a natural Hotelier, from arrival to departure the whole team were faultless. We stayed in the Blue Mosque suite, and the views, atmosphere and location were just perfect. As are the breakfasts. Well done Fatih and Team five stars from us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point makes you feel at home in a foreign land!”
Reviews.Author: Ginggay
Reviews.Content: Hotel owner and staff go the extra mile to please. The environment is very homey and personalized. The room is more than comfortable. Breakfast was lovely. And the location was perfect, a minute walk to the Blue Mosque!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point deserves its name!”
Reviews.Author: Nurana_Jafarli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Best Point Hotel for 2 weeks n didnt notice any lack.Its location is perfect,close to the important mosques.In spite of this rooms r quiet ,also they r clean n comfortable.The staff is very friendly n helpful.I'd like to tell about the amazing view from the terrace to the Marmara Sea n the Blue Mosque where we had our breakfast,which was very various. We definitely advice Best Point Hotel everyone who wanna spent his holiday in best way. We choose this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews,I hope this review will help u to make right decision too.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a quality and even stylish hotel in Europe”
Reviews.Author: rollo19
Reviews.Content: After so many so called 4 star hotels in Central Europe, we finally found something that compares with a good brand, 4 star in Auz/NZ. We did some research and chose Best Point. Rooms were nicely and properly fitted out, quality AC, quiet room and qiuet end of well located street - close to Sultanhamet amongst all the tourist hotspots. The roof top terrace is super nice as well. You can see the mosque and out over the harbour. Tip - go in Sept, head over to the bridge to Tepebasi to find a modern Istanbul to eat outside of the Tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “staying at best point hotel was an amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: amoulawashington
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 weeks vacations in Istanbul where i stayed at best point hotel with my daughter and sister. Wow! I don't know from where to start, so many good things to talk about. I will try not to forget anything. Before choosing this hotel I read the trip advisor reviews. Based on the reviews and the constant communication with Fatih (the owner) who was prompt in answering my emails and providing me with all the explanations I ended choosing best point hotel. Since the minute I stepped in I knew I made the right decision, the checking in was fast with no complications or surprises, they rapidly took me to my room taking into consideration that we were very tired after a long trip. the rooms are nicely decorated in neutral relaxing colors, spotless and with a beautiful view to the blue mosque. Most of all , from someone who suffers of chronic pain back, what I enjoyed the most was the mattress, surprisingly during all my stay I did not feel the pain. I can only thank Fatih for not ignoring the comfort part. the location was the best near to all main sites. The view of the blue mosque and marmara see from the terrace was breathtaking. The breakfast was beyond expectations! from freshly baked cookies and cakes to numerous jellies to various flavors of tea , omelets, olives tomatoes,cheeses, fruits ect... you can never deny the high quality of the breakfast in this hotel. The service was impeccable their hospitality was overwhelming everyone made us feel at home. Everything I wrote so far was for the readers who like to choose a hotel based on the reviews just like i did. Now I am going to talk about the friends I made at best point. Friends who helped me to fully enjoy this beautiful city, they gave me tips on how to get around, always willing to direct me to the best places. Friends who touched me in so many ways, I don't think i would ever find a more beautiful and hospitable people. Thank you to all the stuff, thank you to Fatih for all the help and the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great Turkish hospitality”
Reviews.Author: maens
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through the Internet after I read the reviews, after I booked the hotel I have contacted the hotel email to make sure of my booking and to gather more information regarding the hotel such as wireless accessibility and shuttle from the airport, I got a prompt answer from the hotel owner Mr. Fatih and he answered all of my emails. Our flight has arrived Istanbul 8:30 in the morning and after we got to the hotel, Mr. Fatih has welcomed us, offered us a drink and a breakfast which we've done at the top floor terrace, the view from the hotel terrace is Amazing ( Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and the sea from two sides), this was very refreshing, after we have finished our breakfast we received our room which was a great gesture from the hotel. the room was very clean and well decorated, it is the same size as the room we got in Paris last year so it's size is normal in old city of Istanbul. After we have rested in the room we asked Mr. Fatih advice for touring in Istanbul, and he helped us to organize our four and half days stay, I must say that his advices were very helpful, for example he advised us not to buy from the Grand bazaar because the prices are too high and instead buy from Istiklal street (Takseem Square), and after we bought from the Grand bazaar we realized that he was correct. I must mention here the great location of the hotel, it is very close to all important historical sights in Istanbul such as the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia and Topkapi palace, all were a walking distance from the hotel in addition to Sultanahmet Tram station which is near Aya Sofia. This is very convenient because even if you don't know where to go or if you just want to hang out, you can walk to the park near Aya Sofia and the Blue mosque and enjoy the fountain and all people from all of the world going there. Istanbul is a very beautiful city, people are very polite and helpful (although their English is not perfect), also the city is very clean, it's topography is very convenient, the sea is everywhere and the city hills are full of historical mosques that you can see from everywhere. If you like just to walk and blend with locals you must go to Taksim square, Ortakoy (to eat Kumpere) and if you want to enjoy the Bosphore in addition to silence walk you can go to Bebek and walk besides the see, enjoy a cup of tea and the beautiful houses in this rich neighbourhood. At all, our stay at the hotel was Excellent and we liked Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Friendly, Nice and Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RobAhanes
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel because of its manager, staff, clean rooms, great view, nice terrace for breakfast and its historical style. The rooms are so comfortable and nice. It has a wonderful view too. This hotel also has Free Wireless Internet access. The staffs are so friendly and this made me more relax there. I Love You, Fatih! You were so Nice...I hope to see you again! ;-) Rahanes [--]

Reviews.Title: “The Best Point Hotel Is Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NormMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Point Hotel twice on my recent visit to Turkey(July 12-18 and August 5), and thought it was an excellent hotel. The location is superb- a short walk to the Arasta Bazaar, Palace Mosaics Museum, and Blue Mosque. The staff was friendly and helpful, particularly when I had to leave some fragile items in storage at the hotel, while I travelled to other parts of Turkey. I was concerned about the fragility of some of the gifts I had purchased(ceramic statue, painted ostrich egg, etc.), but the Best Point staff were fabulous in finding a large box, placing the gifts inside, taping the box up, and then placing the marked box in a secure place. Also, they were able to arrange 3 AM transport to the airport for me when I was departing. Fatih, the owner, is a gem. Not only is he a source of good information about Istanbul, but he is a very amusing, entertaining character! My first stay at the Best Point, my room was very clean and nice, but a bit small. On my second visit, my room was bigger. I should also mention that the breakfast spread was very good- it was superior to other breakfasts offered by other hotels I stayed at while in Turkey, both in terms of quality and variety. The upstairs terrace is charming with good views. I will return to Turkey and would definately stay at the Best Point Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: gretchen123NewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the suite (which was very affordable) with a large terrace overlooking the blue mosque. beautiful views. a large & varied complementary breakfast is served, which you can have on the roof with views of the sea. Clean, well priced, in walking distance to all the main sites. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tbanAnkara
Reviews.Content: Ignore the review below. This place has a fantastic location and the service is outstanding. The staff went out of their way to make our stay more comfortable and pleasant. Highly recommended. I will stay here again when I'm in Istanbul for business or pleasure. People who write reviews like the one from BC don't know or appreciate the Turks. In Turkey it is simply good manners to sit down, drink tea and socialize with your hosts. Even at a hotel. Furthermore, it is common in Istanbul for these older Ottoman homes not to have an elevator. Lasty, is the value and price the Best Point charges. I travel frequently to Istanbul on business and you can easily pay $200-280/night at a hotel. This place is a bargain. It also has a terrific and healthy breakfast. So, sure, it doesn't have an elevator and, yes, they are extremely friendly. But this isn't Canada. It's Turkey! Enjoy this great country and this terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “YOU SHOULD BE STAYED BEST POINT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: johnezzekmi
Reviews.Content: We are a couple staying in Antalya /Turkey .Last month of Juy we stayed in this cute butique hotel. During our stay, they were preparing for the summer season and making some important changes. We rally liked it. I booked at the Best Point Hotel and from day one it was amazing. All of the staff was exceptional and nice and very willing to please. Mr. Fatih the Manager and partner Mr.Emrah was the greatest host ever and helped with all of my questions and needs. Best stay with the utmost staff ever Thanks for all help....Really i am must recomended Best Point Hotel..You just book and go. Good Luck Mr.John Ezzekmi

Reviews.Title: “Don't beleive the Hype.”
Reviews.Author: JeunneFemme
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel for the same reason as just about every other guest who stays there. Because of this site. We actually overheard many other travellers tell the hotel management this specifically. But, upon arrival, we were immediately dissapointed. The staff is friendly -- that is clear. But maybe too friendly. After 20+ hours of travel, the hotel staff insisted on sitting us down in the lobby to tell us what we should do and where we should go during our visit. Instead, we just wanted to go to our room to decompress. This continued througout the entire stay, with the staff breathing down our necks the entire time. If you like privacy, this is not the place for you. You can't even pick up a piece of toast without someone rushing over to hold your plate for you. The rooms were tastefully decorated, yes. But they were very small, and our double bed was only two singles pushed together. You'd imagine that you'd get a real double bed for these prices and not wake up stuck in a hole. Also, our door had quite a large crack in it, and you could even stand in the hallway and look right into our bedroom and at the bed directly! Another thing of note is that the hotel is four stories high (five to get to the rooftop) and there is no elevator. If you are in any unable to climb flights upon flights of stairs, this is not the hotel for you. Last thing I wanted to note is that the lobby computer has the trip advisor site as their homepage. The hotel staff very much encourage guests to write reviews on the site, and this is probably skewing the results on this page.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: Leila_Candy_Baby
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a strategic position,near to the most famous attraction in town like the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi. Staff is very helpful and kind. Breakfast offers a huge selection of every kind of delicious typical meals. Rooms are a bit small but confortable and clean....a pleasure to stay! Enjoy also the great view from the terrace on the top of the hotel ;)

Reviews.Title: “There isnt a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ArunKaicker
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. And our choice could'nt have been better!!! The location was perfect, minutes from the Blue Mosque and other sights. The room though on the smaller side, was more than adequate for me and my wife. Very clean room and bath. Breakfast left us spoilt for choice, there was so much to select from. And what can one say about Fatih!!!! The perfect host and a complete font of information which was given with great patience and thought. He infact organised our 4 day stay in Istanbul almost completely with little effort from us, ensuring we saw all that there was to see. We were particularly touched by his offer of breakfast when we returned early in the morning from a trip to the Mountain Resort Ilgaz and were waiting to catch our transport to the Airport. ( We had checked out at the hotel a week earlier). Yet he insisted we have breakfast at the Hotel. Very thoughtful indeed. A holiday made perfect by a perfect host. Thank you Fatih

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpfull and polite staff”
Reviews.Author: Hillerup
Reviews.Content: We arriwed in Istanbul 23.00, and I lost my handbag with passports and flyingtickets. Told the staff in the reception on Best Point Hotel, who immedieately phoned buscompagny and friends in the city. Within a few hours Emrah and friends brought back my bag, nothing missing! Thought it would be impossible to solve such a problem in such a big city. THANK YOU. We were always met with a : No problem" Besides we enjoyed the spectacular wiew from the roof, overlooking Bosphorus, The Golden Horn, The Blue Moscue and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Room 403”
Reviews.Author: hebnerdo
Reviews.Content: There are so many good things to say about Best Point, that I truly do not know where to begin. Fatih, one of the owners, had everything ready for us. Even provided a ride for us from a previous business hotel to Best Point. Greeted us with tea and pastries. Sat with us to plan our 4 1/2 day stay. Aranged a personal tour of places outside the immediate walking area. And since we arrived during the noon time, a fruit plate was brought up which we enjoyed on our balcony. I read in other review that the room was small but we had enough space for everything including putting our suitcases in the closet. We had been to a business conference so we had a lot of clothing but everything fit. I highly recommend Room 403 as it does have a nice balcony. But keep in mind that there are stairs...if you have difficulty with stairs, then they have rooms on the lower levels. There is a restaurant row to the right of the hotel where we ate most evenings. The first night Fatih arranged for the Kalamar Fish restaurant to pick us up and return us to the hotel...Then the rest of the time, we ate at the Aria on their roof, The Metropolis, and at Ocean's 7. All were good. We were steps away from the Blue Mosque.... There is a Turkish bath in the room which felt wonderful after a day of touring. Everyone in Istanbul was very inviting and friendly. If you choose to go, Best Point is where you should stay. Great location. Oh and one other thing...if you do not have a balcony, there is a terrace on top of the building where many people who are staying at the hotel have breakfastt. Loved it! Thanks Best Point. Donna

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Istanbul - I will return”
Reviews.Author: belmore53
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice , relaxed hotel just a few minutes walk to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. Fatih and his staff gave exceptionally good and friendly service. Breakfast was on the rooftop or in the dining room. The rooftop was a also good place in the evenings to hang out or do email The Blue Mosque Suite with a private Turkish bath was certainly worth a few addtional euros.

Reviews.Title: “Go on, have one more piece of Turkish Delight!”
Reviews.Author: Bal747
Reviews.Content: This small well run Hotel in the heart of the historic district of Sultanahment is a great place to set up base camp when visiting Istanbul. The well kept rooms and very friendly staff go a long away in exemplifying the warm hospitality that is received all over Istanbul. Have your breakfast each morning on the roof terrace watching ships come in and out of port on the Bospherous whilst sitting in the shadows of the Blue Mosque - the great views from up on the 5th floor are litteraly the icing on the cake. At their modest prices per night, you would do well to consider this little gem.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: smashingmelons
Reviews.Content: You can not go wrong if you choose to stay at the wonderful, quiet little hotel with Fathi and his staff. We were only in Istanbul for a few days, not long enough to make the most of all it has to offer, and we will be returning as soon as possible when we will stay at Best Point again. The location is fantastic with views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus from the terrace where you can enjoy a fabulous breakfast, your every whim attended to by the excellent staff. The room we stayed in was lovely, the turkish delights carefully placed on the bed each day just one example of the incredible attention to detail this hotel offers. You will begin to enjoy Turkish hospitality at its very best from the moment you arrive at Best Point as Fathi sits you down to enjoy tea and pastries whilst he introduces you to the delights of Istanbul and protects you from the evil eye!

Reviews.Title: “overlooking The blue mosque and Bosporous at the same time.”
Reviews.Author: Lysthuset
Reviews.Content: Fatih and his staff takes spesial care of you ,so you feel like beeing a vip person.We booked 3 rooms,and all were clean and nice.Especially The blue mosque room.All rooms had aircondition. From the dinning terrace you can see Bosporous and Asia.Here you can eat your breakfast. in a beautiful atmosphere. Staying here you are in the middle of most of the historic sites.It is waking distance to it all.I hope to come back to Istanbul soon,and then I will stay at Best Point Hotel again. Best regards Per John Solbrekke

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful position in the Old Town of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BELMONTIpswich
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel, in an excellent position in the old town - all the main sights are in very easy walking distance. The staff are very friendly & helpful - the breakfast selection is superb & the view from the roof terrace is excellent - right next to Blue Mosque & overlooking the Bosphorus. The bedrooms are a little small & need more cupboard space but are attractive & very clean. There are many good resturants only a few metres up the road. You only have to step out of the hotel & you are in the real Istanbul without having to travel anywhere - the modern tram line is only a few minutes walk away so it is easy to travel to other areas without any problems - the tokens for the trams are sold from a little kiosk near the stops, and used to get on the platforms.

Reviews.Title: “Top 5 reasons why you should stay at Best Point - book today”
Reviews.Author: AJCCSIC
Reviews.Content: 1: Sultanahmet is the best location for a short stay in Istanbul - right in the middle of the most atmospheric, charismatic, old and beautiful part of this huge city. Why waste your time travelling from other areas of the city, when you know this is where you want to be? 2: When you are in Akbiyik Caddesi you feel as if you are in a small village - not a metropolis. Best Point is at the quiet end of Akbiyik Caddesi, peaceful but still within a minute's walk of friendly, welcoming cafes and bars, and Arasta Bazaar of course. 3: Customer service at the hotel is spot on - attentive, informative and professional when you need it; chilled and unintrusive when you don't. There is a roof terrace with spectacular views of the Blue Mosque and the sea. Breakfast is really very, very good. Rooms? - yes they are small; yes there are a lot of stairs - you're in an old building in Istanbul - love it for what it is or find a Novotel. 4: The hotel is highly rated, yet is still a small hotel (though expanding - new suites added this year). It is very popular for the reasons I have stated, so if you want to stay in the best place you need to book your room today. 5: Just do it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: farooq33
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Best Point with a little trepidation...booking boutique hotels is somewhat of a hit and miss game. Having spent three nights here, I'm quite happy I trusted the plethora of positive reviews of the Best Point I read on Trip Advisor prior to our trip. The location was unbeatable...the room was very, very clean...and the service was first rate. Highly, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Class Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCor-Doy
Reviews.Content: A really nice friendly hotel with the most efficient staff. Good location with nice restaurants very close. Excellent room beautifully presented for our arrival. This hotel has the best Turkish breakfast -- well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean rooms, helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Marie-en-Ludo
Reviews.Content: This neat hotel offers everything one needs for a good citytrip. The only negative point is works being conducted next to the hotel are a bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: TdotandBeyond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this charming hotel for several nights, and were very impressed by the excellent service. The staff were truly hospitable, and we had a great experience. Our stay at the hotel was broken into two segments (when we first arrived in Turkey, and again before we left). When leaving the first time around, we had to leave the hotel at around 4 in the morning in order to catch a flight to central Anatolia. Much to our surprise, the hotel staff had prepared breakfast for us, along with piping hot tea. In addition, we left one of our suitcases at the hotel, and this was already placed in our room when we returned. Further, I note that we forgot to lock the suitcase before we left. Although it contained a valuable laptop, we were not in the slightest concerned, and for good reason. In short, we have never experienced the level of service that we enjoyed at Best Point, and would gladly return on any future visit.

Reviews.Title: “an exceptional little hotel. perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: chocokatt
Reviews.Content: i am not sure where to begin. this small and friendly hotel, located on a quiet side street in the Sultanahmet, is exceptional in every way. the room was immaculate. one can say it was small, but definitely not small by european standards as there was plenty of walking space and a little armchair and a table in our room (we booked a standard room on the third floor). both the bathroom and the room appeared to be newly renovated. upon arrival to the hotel (the staff arranged pickup for us at the airport), we were greeted with tea, coffee and little cakes while we filled out the paperwork. our bags were carried up the stairs (yes, they are steep. and no there is not an elevator. but i wouldn't let this prevent you from staying here. i found the steep stairs just part of the charm. i am six months pregnant and i just took breaks between each of the flight of stairs.). when we arrived in our room we found a bowl of turkish candies on the bed. and later that evening when returning from some sightseeing and dinner, we found a plate of fresh fruit waiting for us in the room. the staff are exceptionally friendly. and you truly get the impression that nothing is too much to ask of them. incredibly service minded. your happiness and comfort level is their top priority. the breakfast buffet is in the basement of the building. but don't miss the opportunity to have your plates brought up to the large roof terrace, with views over the marmara sea and the blue mosque. a lovely way to start your day. the buffet is a large selection of meats, cheese, jams and spreads, yogurt, milk, cereal, breads and sweets. omelets can be made to order, no extra charge. and for a small fee you can get freshly squeezed orange or carrot juice. every afternoon/early evening, there are complimentary tea, coffee and sweets in the lobby. there is an internet station in the lobby, as well. though, we were traveling with a laptop and found the wireless connection to be outstanding. with a bit of help from the staff, we connected immediately and without problem throughout the trip. there is a safe in the room, though it is quite small (so only truly teany tiny travel computers will fit in this). on our last evening in istanbul, we came back to our room to find a plate of fresh fruit waiting for us, along with a small, but quite elaborate, chocolate cake. and of course, more turkish candies. it was such a lovely surprise and nice little goodbye from the hotel. such small gestures, truly were a welcome. and unlike any service my husband and i have ever had (and we travel quite a bit). i can't say enough good things about the hospitality of the staff. this was our first trip to istanbul and we found the neighborhood to be an outstanding starting part for the trip. it is far enough away from the tourist ghetto. and you have some great restaurants nearby (just weed them out from the bad ones!). when we return to istanbul after the baby is born (we liked it that much!) we will definitely stay at the best point hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GaNaIST
Reviews.Content: If you ever wanted to visit Istanbul, just give a call to the managers Fatih and Emreh of Best Point Hotel where you will not regret. Me and my girlfriend had a wonderful time with our stay in this hotel for 4 days and both managers made sure our trip to be a memorable one from the time we were picked up from the airport to the day we left. With the on time pick ups from the airport, clean rooms, large breakfast, evening tea and coffea, and complimentary desserts , just added more glow to our stay here. The ever helping staffs also advised us well on best places to eat , visit, shop and clubbing and even Turkish baths with free pick ups and drop offs! As all the major attractions within minutes away on foot/tram ,I thoroughly recommend this Best Point hotel to anybody who wants to have a great time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Muckraker54
Reviews.Content: In everyway, "Jay" and his staff provided service as good as any I have received in any hotel, regarldess of its star rating. They understand that ratings on sites such as Tripadvisor are vitally important to their success. Their level of service and attention to detail should always earn them top ratings! The room was a little on the small size when compared to the average American hotel, but the space was well utilized, the room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. The quality of the furnishing, the craftsmaship of the Ottoman woodwork, and the bed clothing were top notch. The bathroom was also well done. Travertine on the floor and walls, a nice enclosed shower, and plenty of water pressure (and hot water)! The Best Point provides a nice breakfast buffet with the opportunity to take your plate to the rooftop terrace overlooking the Bosporous. It was a great way to start the day. The location of the hotel was perfect for us for two reasons. First, it was an easy 5 minute walk to the Blue Mosque/Aya Sophia, the Hippodrome, and on to the tram that goes to the Grand Bazaar. Second, and probably more importantly, being in our 50's, the hotel was away from the cluster of youth/backpacker hotels to the North and was much more laid back and quiet. What did we like the best? Where to start - the room or the staff? We actually don't have a complaint about either. What did we like least - perhaps the steep stairs but that is the only "bad" comment I can make and should not influence your decision to choose this hotel for you visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel, terrific staff,small room but clean and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: colandlynda
Reviews.Content: Buffet breakfast was great, the staff were very helpful and so friendly. We walked to all tourist sites. Resturants were just up the road so the hotel was in the quiet part of the street. The room was small but similar in size to the one in Venice. Everything was very clean , there was no lift but it didn't matter because we felt so at home. Thanks for your anniversary cake and drink on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than Best Point”
Reviews.Author: Fishyweb
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel to stay in for our first visit to Istanbul. It is in a great location, convenient for all the sights of the old city, and for trams to other areas as well, and plenty of eateries in the area as well. The staff are friendly, and nothing is too much trouble for them. Complimentary tea, coffee, and nibbles are freely available, and offered at every opportunity. Breakfast is very good, and can be enjoyed on the rooftop terrace (complete with views over the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque). The room was immaculately clean and very comfortable. And at the end of our stay, they even gave us a complimentary lift to the airport. Overall, we could not have wished to stay in a nicer hotel. Where will we stay on our next trip to Istanbul? The Best Point, without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “The best point about our stay in Istanbul was ... The Best Point”
Reviews.Author: offspin1
Reviews.Content: Sultanahmet Best Point Hotel Sender : Donna Pollak 13.05.2009 The hotel was perfect for us. Small and friendly, beautifully done out, clean and comfortable with lots of nice little touches like a welcome bottle of wine and tray of fruit. Service was excellent and all the staff were friendly and helpful. Perfect location for walking to all the main sites and lots of good restaurants to choose from just up the road. Superb breakfast which you can have on th roof terrace with views of the Blue Mosque etc. Fahti will advise on tours, routes to the various places of interest and restaurants with entertainment if you want further afield -free pick ups available. We would go back. Thank you for a lovely stay all at Best Point. Donna and Mike Pollak Close the Window

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GCH059
Reviews.Content: From first (hotel arranged limo to pick us up at airport at midnight) to last (hotel manager waved us off in limo back to airport 3 days later) this was a stay that exceeded our expectations. The service, from all of the staff, was first class. Nothing was too much trouble, tips and recommendations were excellent, and the overall approach to customer service was faultless. Breakfast was served in a well appointed downstairs room and was much better than you would expect from a hotel this size, including a freshly-cooked hot option. The location was great-5 minutes from the Blue Mosque and the main tourist area- but away from the traffic, so relatively quiet ,apart from the calls to prayer of course! The view from the rooftop terrace is great-the sea and the city. Why go anywhere else? Gordon and Heather

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantstic Location!”
Reviews.Author: sarah-hur
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to be in the centre of a truly historical city. The location puts all the delights of Istanbul on your doorstep. The Hotel is situated within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Saint Sofia, The Golden Horn, Grand Bazaar, Spice Market and spectacular views of this amazing city. From the Hotel roof terrace you have a view of the ocean and the Blue Mosque lit beautifully at night. Our room had an elegant decour, was comfotable and spotlessly clean. The staff are genuinely helpful and friendly and the food was delicious. The price is very resonable for the great location and the high standard of hotel. My husband and I had a wonderul time and would certainly return to this hotel again. Many thanks to Emrah!

Reviews.Title: “Best Point is the Best”
Reviews.Author: john_franklin
Reviews.Content: We are a couple staying in Marmaris/Turkey. Last week of april we stayed in this cute butique hotel. During our stay, they were preparing for the summer season and making some important changes. We rally liked it. When we talk with the owner of the hotel (mr. Fatih YÄ±ldÄ±rÄ±m) we asked about the work at the back of the building. And he told us that theyâ€™re extending the hotel and 9 more deluxe suit rooms will be added. We were rally glad to hear that because we think they deserve it. The atmosphere at the hotel and the friendship between the hotel team was great. They really care about their guests and they always want to help. Our 2. day we woke up early and went to hotelâ€™s breakfast salon. We couldnâ€™t believe what we saw. The bÄ±ffet was full ol fresh foods and fruits. Cakes and their special breads were amazing. We went many hotels in Turkey and in London also, but the breakfast in the Best Point Hotel was the BEST we ever had. The most important thing is their foods are fresh and unlimited. They also got vegeterian menu at their restaurant. We payed a reasonable price but we were ready to pay much more if we had to. The day we left, mr. Fatih arranged us a free transfer to the airport. Normally the price was 70â‚¬ but we didnâ€™t pay anything. And he told us that their guests are more important than anything. Thanks for everything. We want to go back again in august and stay their new deluxe siuit rooms. Ä°f youâ€™re looking for a place to stay in Ä°stanbul, Best Point is the best you can find. John&Cristina.

Reviews.Title: “BEST POINT HOTEL IS AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: saad_9
Reviews.Content: Our stay in your hotel was really awesome....the breakfast and room service was great..it was quick!! Though the rooms were small...but they were very comfortable..The hotel was situated at a great location as the bosphorus sea and the blue mosque could be seen from the terrace easily...The best thing in the hotel was that we were provided with an internet service..n there was definetely nothing bad about it..that's all i can say about BEST POINT HOTEL...IT ROXX!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...an absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: SundayGrundle
Reviews.Content: We had just returned from Galipolli on a tour and were in need of a break...hello Best Point hotel! We only stayed here for one night but I wish it was longer. The hotel for a start is in an amazing location, right in the centre of old town, 2 mins walk from the Blue mosk and St Sophia and another 2 from the heart of Istanbul, Sultanahmet. On arrival the service you receive from Jay and the crew is second to none...drinks and sandwiches while they prepare your information along with turkish delights a plenty. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms are very comfortable. To top it off the room top balcony boasts one of the best views of Istanbul and amazing to see all the mosks lit up at night. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Z-brox
Reviews.Content: To Istanbul for a meeting our host organization suggested a number of reliable "Brand name" hotels. But as we wanted to keep costs low we searched a little on hotels.com and found this! WOW! A totally more pleasat stay that I have experienced at Four Seasons, Jumeira, Ritz Carlton e t c. You are a person here. Not just a credit card. While still allowed your privacy. Superb location. 3 minutes from restaurants and shops on a quiet street. Every detail renovated, WI-FI and great breakfast (with more exotic choices than I have seen in 5-star hotels) included in price! Agree with other traveller who said it was best deal ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Friendly Staff, Excellent Location, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: Krisvell
Reviews.Content: Best Point Hotel was an excellent choice. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights and left extremely happy with their overall services. We arrived 6:00 in the morning and were greeted by Umit. We booked an Economy Room, but he was kind enough to upgrade us to Superior Room (301) (Thanks Umit!). The location of the hotel doesnâ€™t get any better. Within a few minutes walk from the hotel you can find the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazar, Tram Station, ATMs, Restaurants, Coffee Shops and many other attractions. The hotel also provided us with a great breakfast to start our day and a super clean room with the most comfortable bed to end it. In addition, guests are treated to a free late night snack in the lobby. There is also free WiFi! The manager of the hotel (Jay), was very helpful and made our stay very comfortable. He assisted us in booking a full day tour, and was always available to answer any questions regarding where to go and what to see. He also provided us with a free ride to the airport which usually costs 30 Euro per person. All in all, Best Point Hotel will make your experience in Istanbul unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: UrsulaLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent hotel, a 5-10 minutes' walk from all the historic splendors of Istanbul. The management went out of their way to make us welcome, offering a lot of assistance and refreshments, including home-made cookies. OK, the room was on the small side, but if - like us - you spend all day sightseeing and only come back there to sleep, you won't mind the size of it. Overall - a very positive experience that can enhance the charms of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Point - Best Option”
Reviews.Author: sasster
Reviews.Content: If you plan to stay in Sultanahmet -in the midst of the historical (and therefore touristy) area of Istanbul-, the Best Point Hotel is definitely your best option. What makes this hotel a great stay is its staff. Everybody (including the cleaning lady and the waiter at breakfast) makes you feel welcome and special. The rooms are small, but very clean and thoughtfully decorated. Breakfast is excellent (especially eaten on the roof terrace with sea view) and the lobby features a computer with 24-hour free internet access. The fact that we were given a pair of binoculars to use on the roof terrace sums it up: these people know what you'd like to see or do, even before you think of it. That's service for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Istanbul - great location”
Reviews.Author: HaCao
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in 2 other hotels in the same area (the charming Old Town) before finding this hidden gem behind the Blue Mosque and absolutely felt in love with this place. We got a very good price with the best location and service we could possibly receive. The hotel is super clean with excellent services that deserve a 6 star. Breakfast is awesome. The staff is super friendly and very helpful. Best Point is no doubt the best hotel in a great location. We felt so lucky that we could spend some of our time in this lovely boutique hotel. I'll definitely at Best Point during next visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissyM50
Reviews.Content: Five days in Istanbul at Easter 2009 became a relaxing and interesting experience. Best Point Hotel is a very good place to stay, if you want to discover the most important of what this city can offer. Everything is close, possible to reach by walking. Good location, close to historical places and at the same time quiet and cosy. The rooms are small, but very nicely equipped, good beds, wardrobe, excellent bathroom etc. The hotel staffs were positive and offered very good service. Most of all we will remember the breakfast with so many different foods to choose. Our departure from the hotel became a bit stressed because of a biking race, which closed the streets in Sultanahmet. No taxi could get us from the hotel to the airport. The situation was a bit difficult, also because of luggage which should be taken with. Best Point Hotel offered us the best solution in this situation: â€œWalking taxi serviceâ€� about 30 minutes, included assistance with the luggage. By this service we could find a taxi to the airport. Thanks a lot! Without your help, we should never have reached the flight back to Norway.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal!”
Reviews.Author: Siguiriya
Reviews.Content: If you need an accomodation to visit Istanbul, this hotel is just Ideal! It is a small cozy hotel (or boutique as they call it in Turkey) in the plain centre of this millenary city. It's location is the best to visit the city since ti is located only a few minutes by walking from the main historical attractions in Istanbul. The rooms are small but beautifully decorated and comfortable, and what is more important: perfectly clean! Breakfast is practically superb, you will have the chance to try many turkish delicatesses....and they are delicious! The staff is not only friendly but also really willing to help you if you need advice for your visit to Istanbul, they really care about their customers. It really felt like home and I definetly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Suddenly Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: RitausRome
Reviews.Content: The night before leaving for Budapest (yes, Budapest in Hungary) we were told by Alitalia that our flights were canceled. They offered other departure hours that didn't suit us and after insisting and complaining we were given the chance to change destination. So we ended up in Instanbul. We found the hotel with Tripadvisor in few minutes (it was nearly midnight) and I'm glad to say that the day after (day of departure) early in the morning the manager of Best Point Hotel wrote a confirmation email, and also called us not being sure whether we left already or not. He started planning our trip right there, reminding us that two days was a short time to visit Istanbul (which is true unfortunately). The flight was late (Alitalia again...) and we arrived at the hotel at 5 in the morning, but there was the receptionist and a waiter waiting for us. They took care of us: the day after we woke up late for breakfast but they offered it all the same (whithout us asking), in the afternoon we were offered a glass of wine brought to our room, and also we left on monday at 3 am and againg without us asking they offered tea and cake for an early breakfast. For somebody this could be too much of a kindness, but this is Istanbul people brandmark : they are kind (and smart, mind you!) The location is just great, behing the Blue Mosque which added a certain fascination to our short Istanbul break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Peolple, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miaomiao123
Reviews.Content: The stuff are very helpful, friendly and professional. Good location, near the Tram station, you can take the tram in 5 minutes by boot. Tiny room, but well decorated and clean. The bed is soft, very confortable. Excellent breakfast Quiet street

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor”
Reviews.Author: sf_lhr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for Easter break at an excellent rate and were looking forward to our visit. Three days before our arrival in Turkey I received an email from the manager, that is barely comprehensible, stating our credit card didn't work and as a result they took the liberty of not only canceling our reservation but selling it to someone else. Never mind the fact I use this credit card daily and re-checked the details against our reservation that was e-mailed months ago--given this is over Easter and one of the most sought after dates they surely sold our room to someone else who was willing to pay a higher price. I'm also curious how the manager said he tried calling three times however he only emailed me once--and that was to let me know our room was gone! If you want a well-run operation with trustworthy management there are many other options in Istanbul to choose from. Don't say you haven't been warned...look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, what a find!”
Reviews.Author: walkingbackwards
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with easy access to old town sites. Wonderful, helpful staff. The balcony has amazing views but a little cold in April. Recommend without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome , really helpful staff, home from home”
Reviews.Author: shotties
Reviews.Content: Awesome , really helpful staff, home from home . Stayed for 5 nights at the back end of March . Received a lovely welcome on arrival and the staff were really helpful throughout . The hotel is close to all the major sightsseing venues of the Blue Mosque , Hagi Sophia, Basiilca Cistern . It seems extremely good value for money and a service that far exceeeded expectations

Reviews.Title: “Best Point Hotel - best place in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: RolandasVilnius
Reviews.Content: I and my wife stays in this hotel for 5 days. Location between the Blue Mosque and Bosperous, quite touristique but very nice. Very nicely decorated and equipped small rooms, a view to the Mosque, the best breakfast buffet compared to several four stars hotels, friendly reception, wonderful roof terrasse with a view across Istanbul and across Bosperous.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: rajbbhatt
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. I frequent 5 star hotels for business and I travel with family often finding value. I struck gold. This is BY FAR/HANDS DOWN the best value for your money ANYWHERE I have been in the world. Let me explain: 1) I paid 60 euros a night for a double room ($75) 2) The location is fantastic as it is only 5 minutes walk to Sultanahmet (Blue Mosque), Hagia Sopia and Topkapi Palace! 3) When we arrived, we were greeted very well with sweets and all staff taking care of everything perfectly 4) I was traveling with my 9 month old son. The staff went above the call of duty and bought a new cot and a baby bathtub. I told them it wasnt necessary but they still went ahead an got it. No five star hotel has done that (without paying for it) 5) Breakfast is superb. Great selection and lots to eat. Hot omelletes as well. 6) We also were brought our buffet plates up to the terrace where you have a superb view (unobstructed) of the Blue mosque and the Sea of Marmara. Beautiful. 7) Every afternoon were were asked for tea or coffee (complimentary) and were delivered it within 3 minutes each day after ordering with a nice surprise of a plate of cookies/biscotti. Fantastic. 8) The hotel is owned by an artichetct and it shoes. It is renovated beautifully and it is well decorated and looks new. The bathrooms are small, but adequate, clean and nice looking. 9) Free internet 10) Fatih and Imrah were fantastic hosts/managers who took care of everything and gave great suggestions. They became like family. I am forgetting a lot of things, but I am very satisfied with this stay. I would recommend this place to any everyone. The only one drawback to this hotel is that if you are wishing for a livelier evening and nightlife, you have to head out to the new part of Istanbul to Beyoglu. Sometimes we taxi'd it and sometimes we took the tram. But this isnt the hotel's fault. It was my choice to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, central and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Torunn65
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Best Point hotel was a pleasure from we arrived until we left. The hotel staff (Emrah and his collegues) was friendly and helpful, and included us as part of "the family". The rooms were clean, and nicely decorated, the breakfast was good, and the terrace was perfect for champagne drinking (or take your coffee there in the mornings) and just enjoying the view of the Blue moskÃ¨ and the Marmara sea. Istanbul is a very interesting city, the Turkish people very friendly and helpful, and a visit to the hamam (turkish bath) is a must. We recomend you find a local one instead of the ones mentioned in the guide books. The carpet sellers are very persistent. If you don't want to look in their shops you have to be very clear about that, unless you want them following you around. Enjoy a visit to one of the restaurants outside the spice bazar, or just stroll around in the city at you leasure. We definately recommend a stay in the Best Point hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE Best Point”
Reviews.Author: m_uakilov
Reviews.Content: Very nice and cozy place, very responsive and friendly staff.. if you have question they have right answer ;) if you have some problem they have excellent decision ;) ...next time I'll stay only at Best Point!! Good Luck and See You!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Point really is an apt name!”
Reviews.Author: jimp121
Reviews.Content: This is very small family run boutique style hotels were all the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help. It presently consists of 13 rooms but there is work in progress to extend to 20+ luxury suites. That wasnâ€™t a problem as the workers tended to start after we had left for a dayâ€™s sight seeing. The location is just perfect for that and literally only five minutes walk from the Blue Mosque. It is very clean and everything described on the website was there although the rooms were slightly small, but hey we only slept there. Every morning, the staff, always charming, smiling & helpful set up a great buffet breakfast to start our day. Although the only hot item available was freshly made to order omelette, that didnâ€™t bother us as there was always a good variety of cold meats, cheeses, cereal, pastries and fruit to eat. In warmer weather you can breakfast on the roof terrace which has views of the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus, (great for night shots!).There are plenty of restaurants within 100-200 metres, within all price points, that serve a variety of food comparable and surpassing that of restaurants in the middle of Istanbul. Do not hesitate to book a break with this hotel, they treat you as family and we will definitely return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: EVE77Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: We felt very welcome at this friendly hotel. The rooms, although not very big, but big enough for the purpose of a city trip, were very clean and the beds big and comfortable. Excellent shower. The breakfast, included, was fine, not great. Location: in the backpacker area right behind the Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. 7 min walk from the tramstation. In feb it was a very good deal for your money!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: I75
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed in Best Point Hotel for 2nights/3days and we really enjoyed our stay for many reasons : The sober design. Beige and golden colours make its effect ! At the same time, it wasn`t too much. The Shower is beautifully designed. Very good location in the Sultanahmet area, close to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace. The Turkish Hospitality ! We arrived quite early before check in time and Jay managed to get us a room ! Some minutes after, somebody knocked at the door bringing some freshly squeezed oranges for us... A real treat ! The best thing about the hotel is Jay... ( I hope I have spelt your name right...) ! A natural born Star (!)... Dynamic, stylish, very good looking, very enthusiastic about his work, and always trying his best to please his guests and making all he can to make our stay a memorable one... All the other receptionnists, and personnel were extremely helpful, always smiling and ready to help... Negative points : Very objectively, we really haven`t been displeased by any aspect. It`s hard to find a negative point to this hotel ! Thank you BEST POINT HOTEL for making our stay a memorable one... I. from Paris and R. from M`tius.

Reviews.Title: “no doubt the best hotel”
Reviews.Author: peerke
Reviews.Content: Small but very nice hotel in area Sultanahmet. Quite near bus and tram. The management and service were very gently and excellent. We will come back next year when new rooms are build and hamam is ready. If you are looking for a nice hotel we advise to take this best point hotel. Peter and Marjo from Holland

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, warm and friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: escapeseeker
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the comments on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed! The hotel is small and intimate and the location is perfect! (Just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sophia) and within easy walking distance of the Grand Bazaar and trams and trains to access all of Istanbul. We found all the staff really friendly and helpful and the rooms were spotless and tastefully decorated. We were three adults sharing a room, so it was a little cramped, but this certainly did not spoil our stay. The breakfast was a wide buffet selection of cheeses, cold meats, fresh fruit and vegetables as well as fresh bread and cakes, perfect for setting you on your way for a days sightseeing. The hotel has a lovely roof terrace, with great views down to the Bosphorus and of the Grand Mosque in the other direction. The hotel has no lift and the stairs are steep, so would not be suitable for elderly or disabled travellers, however Istanbul as a city is hilly and cobbled! All in all the Best Point Hotel is a great little find in a vibrant and interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “best vacations of my life ;)”
Reviews.Author: inniziz
Reviews.Content: The best point hotel its very nice hotel, the hotel staff its very kind and if you have problem they always can help you, the room its very clean and romantic, the breakfast its good, with fresh fruits; the hotel location its excellente, you can go walking to visit all monuments. If i come back istambul, its sure, i'll stay again in best point hotel, because its very nice hotel...

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Clubio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and really easy to find. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The room was great, clean, and a wonderful shower! The breakfast was delicious. For those staying both in Winter and Summer time there is air conditioning and heat available in the rooms.
